Basic High-I Slugs
By using advanced fabrication systems, projectiles of common high-isotope materials can be cast and contained effectively.
Basic Ultradense Slugs
Under the effects of certain high-energy fields, traditional metal crystals re-align into denser structures. These result in projectiles with better penetration.
Basic Perfected Slugs

The use of newer machining systems that rely on field and magnetic effects results in projectiles that are perfect copies of each other down to the microscopic level. This provides great advantages in weapon system efficiency.
Basic Unstable Slugs
These slugs are created from relatively unstable non-baryonic matter farmed from the depths of space. Held in form by charged shields, they decompose explosively upon impact.
Imperial Slugs

These slugs are created from unstable non-baryonic matter farmed from the depths of space. Carefully contained in shielded shells developed in the Empire's best weapons factories, they decompose explosively upon impact.
Basic AGN Slugs

The densest known form of matter is found just inside the event horizon of Active Galactic Nuclei. Though harvesting this matter requires incomprehensibly advanced technology, the resultant kinetics are essentially unstoppable.
Improved High-I Slugs
By using advanced fabrication systems and rarer, denser materials, projectiles of improved high-isotope materials can be cast and contained effectively.
Improved Ultradense Slugs
Under the effects of certain high-energy fields, rare and already dense metal lattices re-align into even denser structures. These result in projectiles with better penetration.
Advanced Perfected Slugs

The use of newer machining systems combined with purified adamantian ore results in projectiles that are perfect copies of each other. This allows the development of higher-performing weapons systems.
Advanced Unstable Slugs
These slugs are created from unstable non-baryonic matter farmed in space. Held in form by charged shields within adamantian casings, they decompose explosively upon impact.
AGN Slugs
The densest known form of matter is found just inside the event horizon of Active Galactic Nuclei. Delivered to the target via complex mega-railguns, they are designed to put holes in anything.
Extreme AGN Slugs

The densest known form of matter is found just inside the event horizon of Active Galactic Nuclei. Delivered to the target via specially treated orichalcix nano-railguns, the impact of these slugs is stupefying.
Basic Ion Torpedoes
Stripped of electrons and packed into a dense mass, ions of high-periodicity elements can create explosive warheads that detonate with a very pleasing 'bang!'
Basic Fusion Torpedoes

Fusion reactors, powered by the same reaction that lights the stars, are a powerful source of energy and when miniaturized can form devastatingly effective missiles. The warheads may be the size of a small house, but they are still highly effective.
Basic Decay Torpedoes
If the goal of a weapon is to destroy matter, a very practical way is to accelerate the decay of standard baryonic matter into its sub-atomic components. Loud and dangerous, but practical.
Basic Positron Torpedoes
Various forms of antimatter have been either predicted or known for ages. To make a practical weapon, however, required powerful and portable magnetic containment fields.
Basic Entropy Torpedoes

A side result of experimenting with non-baryonic particles was the discovery that they could be used to locally accelerate entropy. Fortunately, the research lab sent out sufficient documentation before the tests that another lab was able to reproduce the effects AND survive the experiment.
Improved Ion Torpedoes
Stripped of electrons and packed into a dense mass, Titanium-70 nuclei make a particularly effective explosive for ship-to-ship weaponry.
Improved Fusion Torpedoes

Fusion reactors, powered by the same reaction that lights the stars, are a powerful source of energy and when miniaturized can form devastatingly effective missiles. Using very high mass nuclei from Titanium-70 improves their damage.
Advanced Decay Torpedoes

If the goal of a weapon is to destroy matter, a very practical way is to accelerate the decay of standard baryonic matter into its sub-atomic components. Denser and more tightly packed metals like adamantian improve this effect.
Advanced Positron Torpedoes

Various forms of antimatter have been either predicted or known for ages. To make a practical weapon, however, required powerful and portable magnetic containment fields (in this case using adamantian coils) to contain and deliver it.
Extreme Positron Torpedoes
As galactic warfare begins to tamper with causality and reality, extreme anti-particle weapons like these torpedoes become weapons of choice.
Extreme Entropy Torpedoes

A side result of experimenting with non-baryonic particles was the discovery that they could be used to locally accelerate entropy. The only material capable of containing the most advanced versions of this unstable warhead is orichalcix.
Basic Plasma Beam
Hot, high-speed plasma beams are potentially devastating weapons. While they are difficult to use with the interference of a planetary atmosphere, in space they are quite effective.
Basic Pinch Beam
High energy electromagnetic fields are used to "pinch" the plasma generated by controlled fusion reactors. The resulting beam is more than happy to put holes in anything it comes across.
Basic Phased Beam
This laser-induced plasma channel weapon has the additional advantage of hitting the target with a strong electromagnetic field pulse.
Basic Positron Beam
Improvements in the science of magnetics allows some harvesting and control of positrons for the use in beam weapons. While the units are somewhat bulky, the weapons are highly effective.
Basic Positron Beam

Improvements in the science of magnetics allows some harvesting and control of positrons for the use in beam weapons. The mastery of particles in this alien dimension allow the Riftborn to use these key defensive arms.
Basic Anti-Gluon Beam

Gluons, the fundamental quarks that hold together atoms, can be manipulated and interfered with. By dissolving their bonds, molecules in a target can be turned into sub-quantum particles with an enormous release of energy.
Basic Anti-Gluon Beam

Gluons, the fundamental quarks that hold together atoms, can be manipulated and interfered with. In a process familiar to the Riftborn (who could deconstruct matter in their parallel universe), the basic components of atoms are broken down by these beams.
Improved Plasma Beam
Hot, high-speed plasma beams are potentially devastating weapons. These more advanced versions are driven by hyperium fusion systems.
Improved Pinch Beam
High energy electromagnetic fields are used to "pinch" the plasma generated by controlled fusion reactors. With heavy hyperium as the fuel, the resulting beam is correspondingly more powerful.
Advanced Phased Beam
This laser-induced plasma channel weapon has the additional advantage of hitting the target with a strong electromagnetic field pulse. The use of antimatter increases its disruptive effects.
Advanced Positron Beam
More advanced magnetics permit positrons, a form of antimatter, to be contained in relatively small units and channeled into devastating beam weapons.
Extreme Phased Beam
The shifting and multi-dimensional nature of quadrinix is harnessed here to interfere with the laws of physics that keep enemy ships together.
Extreme Anti-Gluon Beam
Gluons, the fundamental quarks that hold together atoms, can be manipulated and interfered with. The phase-shifting nature of subatomics in quadrinix renders this form of beam particularly damaging.
Basic OPAL Laser

An inevitable first step in developing functional space-borne beam weapons, the good old laser is well-known, reliable, and great in a vacuum. A version using Optical Phased Arrays improves punch and power.
Basic Sync Laser
A higher-energy form of the standard laser weapon, synchrotron lasers are widely available thanks to the creation of cheap and portable particle accelerators.
Basic Sync Laser
A higher-energy form of the standard laser weapon, synchrotron lasers are prized by the Vodyani for the color and sound of their beams, which are reminiscent of recordings from Virtual ruins.
Basic MAGGIE Laser
A nickname for the Mega High Energy Laser system, these very high energy output lasers are now possible thanks to improvements in tracking and targeting systems.
Basic HELL Array Laser
An increasing mastery of thermodynamic principles has led to the development of a High-Energy Liquid Lasers mounted in an array configuration for increased destructive power.
Basic TERACO Laser
The use of terawatt COIL [chemical oxygen iridium laser] weapons has been enabled now that low-power, miniaturizes versions of the technology have been developed.
Improved OPAL Laser
A next step in developing space-borne beam weapons, augmenting OPAL systems with hyperium fusion generators as a power supply adds increased output to the laser system.
Improved Sync Laser
An augmented version of the basic synchrotron laser, the addition of a hyperium fusion energy system to power the weapon noticeably increases its effectiveness.
Advanced MAGGIE Laser

An improvement on the MAGGIE lasers, this upgraded version uses antimatter as a fuel source. Thanks to that, quantum-calculated variations in the laser are induced to reduce the risks of dissipation and interference.
Advanced HELL Array Laser
An increasing mastery of thermodynamic principles has led to the development of an array of High-Energy Liquid Lasers driven by antimatter energy.
Extreme HELL Laser
As it is now driven by the extra-dimensional energy source quadrinix, these parallel, super-synchronous laser systems use extremes of mathematics, materials, and manipulation of physical laws.
Extreme TERACO Laser

As it is now driven by the extra-dimensional energy source quadrinix, these laser systems still resemble COIL systems but use complex calculations of time-reversed forecasts to track and target with uncanny accuracy.
Bomber 3 [TBD]
An increasing mastery of thermodynamic principles has led to the development of a High-Energy Liquid Lasers mounted in an array configuration for increased destructive power.
Bomber 4 [TBD]
An increasing mastery of thermodynamic principles has led to the development of a High-Energy Liquid Lasers mounted in an array configuration for increased destructive power.
Basic High-I Plating
By using denser materials, hull integrity and armor resistance to kinetics are improved. These materials are difficult to machine, but highly effective.
Basic Reactive Plating

While the first generations of starship armaments were similar to planetary versions, newer offensive arms require advanced armors. Reactive armor systems have shown to be useful against recent improvements in kinetic and missile weapons.
Basic Monohull Plating

A technology that allows hulls to be 'cast' or 'woven' more than bolted together, monohulls are ships whose hulls are multiple layers of single sheets of long molecule chains, making them resistant and durable.
Basic Inert Plating

One of the goals of ship design is to create armor that renders a ship's hull chemically, magnetically, thermodynamically, and gravitationally inert. They react to almost nothing and are far more difficult to damage.
Basic Inert Plating

One of the goals of ship design is to create armor that renders a ship's hull chemically, magnetically, thermodynamically, and gravitationally inert. With their history of armor and warfare, the Empire is happy to clad their ships in this.
Basic Inert Plating

One of the goals of ship design is to create armor that renders a ship's hull chemically, magnetically, thermodynamically, and gravitationally inert. This appeals to the Unfallen, who see in armor and defense a greater harmony than in offensive weapons.
Basic Impenetrable Plating
A combination of materials, fields, and the use of gravity effects, this is the best technology that science can conceive of for improving kinetic and missile defenses.
Improved High-I Plating
By using the densest available metal, Titanium-70, hull integrity and armor resistance to kinetics are improved. It is costly to machine, but highly effective.
Improved Reactive Plating

While the first generation of starship armaments were similar to planetary versions, newer offensive arms require advanced armors. Reactive armor systems have proved to be useful against recent improvements in kinetic and missile weapons.
Advanced Monohull Plating

A technology that allows hulls to be 'cast' or 'woven' more than bolted together, monohulls are ships whose hulls are multiple layers of single sheets of long molecule chains, making them resistant and durable.
Advanced Inert Plating

One of the goals of ship design is to create armor that renders a ship's hull chemically, magnetically, thermodynamically, and gravitationally inert. They react to almost nothing and are far more difficult to damage.
Extreme Orichalcix Plating
An extreme version of the basic technology, compressed orichalcix is used to add density to the armor and further reduce radiation penetration.
Extreme Impenetrable Plating
A combination of materials, fields, and the use of gravity effects, this is the best technology that science can conceive of for improving kinetic and missile defenses.
Basic Plasma Shielding
Requiring enormous amounts of energy, this shielding system surrounds the ship with a near-impenetrable barrier of dense, ionized gas.
Basic Uniform Shielding

Due to the irregular shapes of starships, it is often difficult to project and maintain shields without creating points where shields are weak or where too many overlap and waste energy. Advanced systems that guarantee perfect ship shielding avoid both these issues.
Cloth of Shielding

By treating the concept of shielding from the architectural point of view of the Vodyani Cloth (their protective suits), numerous solutions are found to reduce the effects of irregularities and power fluctuations that might compromise ship defense.
Basic Plasmoid Shielding
This is an improved use of plasma for ship defense, in which it is shaped into charges and used to deflect and dissipate incoming beams.
Basic Transformative Shielding
Exploiting the networking and field effects of Dust, energy fields can be created around a vessel that transform incoming phased particles -- regardless of their form -- into a dispersed cloud.
Basic Transformative Shielding

Exploiting the networking and field effects of blessèd Dust, energy fields can be created around deserving vessels that transform any incoming phased particles into a dispersed cloud. Hail to the Virtual Saints, whose technology indicated the way.
Basic Graviton Shielding
By controlling the effects of graviton particles and altering the forces of gravity itself, incoming ordinance can be deflected or destroyed.
Improved Plasmal Shielding
Requiring enormous amounts of energy, this shielding system surrounds the ship with a near-impenetrable barrier of dense, ionized gas.
Improved Uniform Shielding
While Uniform Shielding provides basic protection for ships, by augmenting the power source with hyperium an improved level of beam absorption and damage reduction can be reached.
Advanced Plasmoid Shielding
This is an improved use of plasma for ship defenses, in which it is shaped into charges and used to deflect and dissipate incoming beams.
Advanced Transformative Shielding
Exploiting the networking and field effects of Dust, energy fields can be created around a vessel that transform incoming phased particles--regardless of their form--into a dispersed cloud.
Graviton Shielding
By controlling the effects of graviton particles and altering the forces of gravity itself, incoming ordinance can be deflected.
Extreme Graviton Shielding
By controlling the effects of graviton particles and altering the forces of gravity itself, incoming ordinance can be deflected or destroyed.
Allows the use of the Colonization fleet action
Allows the use of the Expedition (analyze Curiosity) fleet action
Allows the use of the Demand Tribute fleet action
Ship will heal 10% of its maximum health at the end of a battle
Every 5 salvo misses from this ship will give a random weapon module 25% damage increase for 10 seconds
Ship gains 5% additional damage on all weapon modules for each different role in the Flotilla
Ship will give a random ship in the flotilla 25% damage reduction for 10 seconds after very 5 hits received.
Ship gains 5% damage reduction for each different role in the Flotilla
10% of damage dealt to section is also dealt to the target's shield
10% of damage dealt to the target's shield is also dealt to the core section of the ship
5% additional damage per different weapon type equipped on ship
100% of damage dealt to core section is also dealt to all outer sections
Draw Essence
This module, built on vaguely understood 'black box' systems from a Virtual temple, draws some essence from living beings within the star system.
Drain Essence
This improved version of the Vodyani draining module leeches greater quantities of essence from the living beings within a star system.
Reap Essence
Though it requires more energy and is much more costly to build, this ultimate version of the essence-draining system reaps great quantities from the inhabitants of a star system.
All Must Provide
Highly sensitive technologies borrowed in increments from the Virtuals permit some minimal amount of Essence to be drawn from lesser creatures. Increases [lifeforceColored] output on your system.
All Must Provide II
Greater technological wisdom allows greater exploitation of the arcane Endless technologies involved in the extraction of Essence. Increases [lifeforceColored] output on your system.
All Must Provide III

While not at the level of the holy Virtuals, your ability to use their technology to efficiently extract Essence from the populations of your systems has further improved. Increases [lifeforceColored] output on your system.
All Must Serve

Pressure-sensitive systems are added to sidewalks, roads, and stairs so that all acts of daily life contribute electrical energy to run the infrastructure. Increases [productionColored] output on your system.
All Must Serve II

Pressure-sensitive systems are enhanced with newer technology, further increasing the electrical energy derived from daily activities and used to run the infrastructure. Increases [productionColored] output on your system.
All Must Serve III

In order to increase the contribution of daily activity to generating energy, a minimum level of physical activity is required of all members of the Church as well as all peoples subject to its rule. Increases [productionColored] output on your system.
All Must Serve IV

The needs of the Church to support its empire have grown. Technology is improved, mandatory daily activity number increased, and giant treadwheels have become the preferred form of punishment for minor offenses. Increases [productionColored] output on your system.
All Must Tithe
Down to the lowest level of society, filtration of Dust and delivery of minimal increments to the Vodyani overlords are demanded from all beings. Increases [dustColored] output on your system.
All Must Tithe II

Centers are established where artifacts can be brought for evaluation. While on the surface it is for faith and science, many of these are broken down and distilled for their Dust. Increases [dustColored] output on your system.
All Must Tithe III

The Church, in order to fill its coffers, has established centers for trade and exchange. Previously viewed as usury, these are now seen as a necessity to support the Church's growth. Increases [dustColored] output on your system.
All Must Tithe IV

Dispensation can now be given to lesser peoples. If they are willing to buy a suspension of their sentence with Dust, they can put off the extraction of their Essence. Increases [dustColored] output on your system.
All Must Study

In order to increase its understanding of technologies, all education at all levels is required to innovate and experiment to improve understanding of Virtual remains. Increases [scienceColored] output on your system.
All Must Study II
The arcane subjects of math and sciences are now given as large a part in academics as the holy writ and the worship of the Virtuals. Increases [scienceColored] output on your system.
All Must Study III

While the Church is used to a highly-controlled and hierarchical structure, certain centers of study have been allowed to relax their rules and requirements. This permits increased creativity and experimentation in research, which in turn increases [scienceColored] output on your system.
All Must Study IV

Given the advanced level of science to which the Church has access, vaults and crypts are being opened, little by little, to allow study and research directly on holy Endless objects. Increases [scienceColored] output on your system.
All Must Worship

Enforced proselytization -- either physical or virtual -- is demanded of Vodyani subjects to increase the number of faithful and improve the image of the Church. Increases [prestigeColored] output on your system.
All Must Worship II

In a galaxy full of strife and worry, the Church appears as a bastion of strength and tradition. This image is encouraged through carefully administered propaganda and controlled tourism. Increases [prestigeColored] output on your system.
All Must Worship III

The Church exploits its special knowledge of the Endless to position itself as the only safe haven for the End of Times. While many dismiss this as selling tactics, many are swayed by the message. Increases [prestigeColored] output on your system.
Core Cracker
The fusion energies of a ship's engine are focused into a particle stream targeted at a planetary core. The destruction of the planet is an inevitable result.
Debris Analyzer
Short-range probes from this module, trading range for increased sensitivity and data capacity, sift through enemy wreckage to pick up information on materials, processes, components, and code.
Hyperium Analyzer
These short-range probes are used after battle to analyze and study enemy ships. After firing blasts of radiation across the spectrum and collecting the results, the data is gathered and collated.
Antimatter Lock-On

This module supplies Antimatter-driven lures that are deployed near large enemy ships. Hiding in the background radiation and noise of these bigger targets, their signature still allows friendly weapons systems to more effectively lock on and hit large targets.
Quadrinix Lock-On

This module uses the dimension-bending capacities of quadrinix to focus weapon fire on large enemy ships. It is because of the relatively inexact science of twisting reality that this is only effective against the largest targets.
Titanium Shrapnel
This unpleasant but effective module targets areas of the ship where life forms are most present. It is designed to puncture the hull, and then the occupants.
Orichalcix Shrapnel
These movement-seeking orichalcix slugs are designed to target any sentient entities inside an enemy ship. They track the crew across various wavelengths, then ruthlessly explode.
Antimatter Lenser

Due to its high energy output, the sub-quantic properties of Antimatter can be used to warp targeting signals and weapons' fire. The result is that a ship equipped with these modules will tend to be targeted more often.
Quadrinix Lenser

Using wave and energy rather than material properties, quadrinix lensing systems are even more effective than their adamantian counterparts. These modules extruded from quadrinix foundries will cause enemy fleets to fire more often on these ships.
Basic Colonization
This module contains the storage space and cryogenic systems needed to send citizens and their supplies to settle new outposts.
Titanium Colonizers

In addition to basic needs, this module has pre-fabricated titanium machine units that colonists can adapt to whatever job is necessary: plowing fields, digging foundations, clearing roads, or building shelters.
Adamantian Sub-Assemblies
The basic colonization supplies are augmented with near-indestructible systems of gears, motors, and wheels that can rapidly be configured into whatever is most needed by colonists.
O2G Delivery Gear
This dedicated module contains the gear and weaponry -- including armor, shuttles, and countermeasures -- required to get assault troops from orbit to their objectives.
Impervious Gear

Many delicate components are required to get assault systems from space to a planet (guidance, maneuvering, landing, deployment). By 'hardening' these different elements, planetary invasion is greatly simplified.
Adamantian Gear
These upgraded deployment components and systems are designed for improving invasion effectiveness as well as hardening troop areas on the ship.
OpEx Gear

Operational execution gear is designed to facilitate the functions of the ship's crew including invasion troops. It improves information collection and dissemination for risks and threats plus recommends courses of action.
OpEx Gear

Overpowered Execution gear is Craver-designed to maximize the medical recovery of the troops as well as their rage and lethality in battle. Unusable--in fact unimaginable--to other peoples, it makes the Cravers who they are.
OpEx Gear
Operational execution gear facilitates crew functions--training, recovery, protection, and attack. It improves information system and includes the latest advance sin Imperial military technology.
Hyper Gear
Rather than protecting crews with denser armor, this troop system uses advanced energy fields to encrypt data and confuse enemy targeting while providing wide-range instant communications.
Hyper Gear

This augments Craver troops with individual shields that also bounce and encrypt signals for secure communications. While the radiation side effects are high, Cravers do not generally expect too much in the way of soldier longevity.
Quadrinix C-Gear

This discovery of Endless Concrete technology is a boon for ship troops and systems. Clearly intended for improving crew efficiency and defense, it exploits the energy signature of quadrinix to protect crew emplacements and accelerate communications.
Plasma Intensifier
This module supplies additional energy to the beam weapon, increasing the output and the damage of the basic weapon system.
Hyperium Intensifier
This alien artifact was apparently an enhanced, high-energy relay for a long-range communication system that relied on laser pulses. It can be easily adapted to increase the output of beam weapons.
Antimatter Intensifier

The unique properties of antimatter can be used to inject signal distortions to beam weapons in real time; this increases weapon effectiveness by counteracting enemy attempts to deflect or dephase energy beams.
Quadrinix Intensifier

This artifact seems to have been a desperate attempt by a failing Concrete Endless enclave to create a matter transporter. While it cannot transport matter, it can be adapted to at least phase-shift beam weapons to increase their effectiveness.
String Gravitics Engine
Allows rapid movement between stars along cosmic string-defined starlanes.
Hyperium Engine
Containment systems permitting hyper-deuterium as a fuel result in greatly increased ship speed.
Warp Drive
Passing from basic string gravitics propulsion to warp bubble time-dilation technology, this engine allows travel off of the cosmic string starlanes.
Accelerated Warp Drive

Warp drive technology is now relatively stable and well known. However, this is the first time that the latest discoveries in quantum mechanics, advanced materials, and high-energy particles have all been worked into a radical new redesign of the warp engine.
Anti-Matter Engine
Using more potent if dangerous fuel, this engine increases ship speed on both cosmic strings and in warp drive.
Improved Probes
By adding advanced data systems and simplified, modular construction, these probes have an improved range and can be built more quickly and stored in greater numbers.
Titanium Probes
More reliable and hardier than earlier generation probes, using titanium allows expeditions to send probes further, gather more data, and build and store more of them.
Hyperium Probes
The advantage of using hyperium in the engine and scanning equipment means that probes have better range, more sensitivity, take less space, and are faster to rebuild.
H-Field Fleet Accelerator
By projecting a weak space-time bubble around the fleet--similar to the warp bubble technology--this module can increase movement speeds of all ships.
A-M Fleet Accelerator
Generating a stronger space-time bubble than hyperium, the antimatter version of this module increases the movement of all ships in a fleet.
Q-Field Fleet Accelerator
The apogee of mass warp bubble compression technology, this quadrinix-driven module greatly increases movement for all ships in a fleet.
Adamantian Repairbots

These hardened adamantian bots are delivered in swarms to repair damage on a flotilla at the end of each phase of battle. When a battle is over and they have less risk of getting damaged, they can work on the entire fleet.
Singularity Repairbots

These hardened adamantian bots deploy in swarms to repair ship damage. Their Riftborn technology makes them unusual, in that damage can--to a limited effect--be time-reversed and its treatment simplified.
Ori-Bot Swarm

The incredible toughness of orichalcix devices means that these robots can be deployed to repair flotilla ships between battle phases. Given that, it is easy for them to do fleet repair once a battle has ended.
Basic Flotilla Shield
Primarily a large and compact power source, this module permits the use of astrophysical plasma fields large enough to create high-energy shielding systems that encompass entire flotillas.
Improved Flotilla Shield
Driven by the latest knowledge in power systems and field theory, this module improves on high-energy shielding systems that encompass entire flotillas.
Quadrinix Fleet Shield
As a powerful and multi-dimensional energy source, quadrinix can be harnessed in this ship module to project a protective field around a fleet that absorbs and misdirects enemy fire.
Adamantian Jammer
Generating reflective and signal-lensing chaff, ships equipped with these jamming modules will be difficult to target and thus will be hit less often.
Orichalcix Jammer
Orichalcix 's extreme density can cause local distortions to gravity and space. These modules take advantage of this effect, causing enemy weapons to be less likely to target and hit equipped ships.
Record/Replay Unit

While essentially a system that tracks battles in order to create After Action Reports, this module is more often exploited for propaganda purposes to laud an empire's victories and downplay its defeats.
OCX R/R Unit

The power behind this upgraded version of the Record/Replay unit lies in the information recording capacity of orichalcix. Using the densest known material as a data store means that the detail of playback--and its use for propaganda--becomes ever more immediate and impressive.
Kinetic Enhancer
This module increases the energy used to fire kinetic weapons, improving their penetration and making them harder to intercept.
Titanium Enhancer
A lost civilization that clearly had a warlike attitude developed this T70 based technology to increase the penetration and damage of projectile weapons.
Adamantian Enhancer
This module is a culmination of using adamantian in several parts of the weapons system--barrels, ammunition, casings, and energy containment.
Orichalcix Enhancer
A lost species of energy-consuming aliens used this technology to pipe energy from stars. It can be handily repurposed as projectile weapon components.
Destructive Salvager
This module processes enemy debris--once the scientists are done with it--and grinds it down into valuable raw materials and Dust.
Adamantian Salvager
This adamantian-toothed grinder turns remnants of enemy ships into sellable resources and Dust.
Nano-repair Bots
Using vast numbers of independent, coordinated nano-robots, installation of this module will allow a ship to repair itself after battle.
Smart T-Repair Bots
Hardened repair robots with titanium exoshells and highly redundant systems can repair ships not only after battle, but in between battle phases.
Delayed H-Repair Bots
These repair robots are driven by hyperium cores. Too fragile for use during battle, they begin repairing after a battle ends and continue to do so every turn.
Smart O-Repair Bots
The ultimate in autonomous repair systems, these near-indestructible robots will repair between battle phases, after a battle, and then will continue to do so with every turn.
Vine Beacon

This specialized Unfallen module plants a sort of arboreal beacon that uses the properties of Dust and ancient technology discovered on Koyasil to bring a vine from the Heart to an adjacent star system.
Antimatter Re-Shield
After the ship has taken damage in battle, this module is triggered to partially regenerate its protective capability.
Quadrinix Re-Shield
After the ship has taken damage in battle, this module can be triggered to regenerate a significant percentage of its protective capability.
Titanium A2S Slugs
These dense, carefully machined projectiles are effective for supporting ground troops during an invasion.
Orichalcix A2S Slugs
These dense, precision-machined projectiles support invading ground troops with devastating effects.
Sophon Free Move
This module allows ships to travel outside cosmic-string starlanes.
This Module allows ships to travel outside the cosmic string-defined lanes.
Sainted Speed
Priests and historians, working together, have unlocked another element of Virtual technology that increases the speed of Vodyani ships. Adoration to the Saints!
Infinity Shield
A powerful Shield of Endless providence. For the Hive!
Infinity Squared Laser
Unique Laser
Unique Base Shield
Superlumeral Engine
A government program of rapid innovation and shared corporate resources resulted in some spectacularly expensive failures, but also this highly efficient new design for ship engines.
Gjallarfire

Taking advantage of coiled laser tech, this little beauty packs a seriously heavy punch. Often called by its alternative moniker, Searing Light, the sound of the weapon cycling up sends deep reverberations echoing through ship hulls.
Emperor Module
Pirate Shield
Pirate Laser
Renewal System
Koyasil Kinetics
Heart's Ward
Heart's Hammer
Disliking the ideas of waste and destruction, battle debris is collected by these modules and recycled into raw materials. As a gesture of good will these goods are given freely to whoever asks.
This weapon fires specialized projectiles formed from many layers of metals. Like the knots in wood, they are exceptionally hard versions of their source materials.
An extension of the living will that supports and guides the Unfallen, this module provides defensive bonuses wherever the ship may be.
As the Unfallen prefer peace and harmony, when they need to strike they do so with all the power they can muster in order to finish battles quickly.

Senator
Senator
We're doing this because it's smart, and because we're the nice guys. Does that work for you?
Seriously? Well, we'll see how long this idea lasts.
chrr--upp--zzz . . . BLUNT: Necessity. Not kindness. Treasure your luck.
zzt--gkk!... MOCKING: Strange. Alien. The Hive watches.
We hope that you will appreciate our glorious restraint, and that you are worthy of this peace.
This peace is bold, I would say. Time will tell if it is also practical.
We hope that you appreciate the Empire's largesse. Perhaps you will even draw some benefit.
You drive the Empire to peace? Let us see if it is worthwhile!
This is necessary and logical. Make the most of your good fortune.
Peace can be arranged. But this side of the Rift nothing is sure.
The Church once again demonstrates its peaceful benevolence. Pray profit from our generosity.
The Church wars only for good reason; we shall see if this peace is meaningful.
This is probably the best deal you've seen in years. With peace comes profits, right?
Peace is less fun without the upstream negotiations. We'll see how it goes.
We hope that you will accept our kindness, and that this peace brings fulfillment to both of us.
We do not spurn peace, even when it is forced upon us. Let us see how it develops.
Welcome to the Sophonity. There are some among us who doubt your intellectual chops. Please prove them wrong.
Well, well, well. Not looking too good for you, is it? We've run the numbers and . . . we're definitely winning this war. But, don't worry. We Sophons aren't butchers. We're declaring this war over.
Smart move. We'll chalk this up as a Sophon victory, then move on to more friendly terms, okay? And you better not try any double-crossing tricks.
So, erm, things aren't proceeding to plan. We're calling this one over. We lost, okay? Can we be friends now?
We Sophons appreciate your leniency. Maybe we could high-five to consolidate this truce?
Don't take this the wrong way, but the Sophonity isn't feeling this "peace" state of affairs. Let's call it a "cold war" and see how things go, yeah?
Really? You want to go to "cold war"? Okay, chump, but don't come crying to us when things don't work out.
This alliance? Not working. Don't take it too hard. It's us not you, okay? And "cold war" doesn't mean "war", right?
Ah, you're killing me! Seriously? The old team? On the scrapheap? Alright, "cold war" it is.
Look, don't take it personal. We Sophons are scientific types. Evidence-based reasoning and all that jazz. Logic dictates that we declare war on your empire. And who can argue with logic, right?
Sheesh! Out and out war? I guess our eggheads should've seen it coming; I mean, they probably did. So, expect defeat, yeah! Well, we'll see you on the battlefield, I guess.
Well, this is awkward. To be honest, this didn't come up in the interview when I got this post, but a Sophon's gotta do their job. You understand, right? So, thing is, we're declaring war. On you.
You're making a big mistake declaring war on the Sophonity. Believe me, I've visited the top-secret development hangars. We're going to science the crap outta you.
I know it's probably a surprise for you, but it is what it is. We're tearing up the peace treaty. Prepare for war!
The Sophonity had hoped for a long and prosperous peace, but if it is war you want, then war you will have. Bring it.
Look, you've been milking this alliance for too long. We're freshening things up with a little bit of war. Think of it like a friend giving you a good slap.
Do you understand the meaning of the word "alliance"? Last time I looked it didn't mean attacking your ally. We're angry. For real. Get ready for a pasting from the Sophons.
Ah, war, the instrument of barbaric races . . . we suspected this truce might not last. The Sophonity will be ready for you.
This cold war's gone far too long. We know you. You know us. How about we sign a peace treaty? Both our peoples are gonna love it. It's a win-win situation!
An offer of peace? Less time worrying about war, more time for learning? For sure. Where do we sign?
Look, it sounds all fluffy mammals and rainbows, but it wouldn't be honest. Let's keep things on ice.
Isn't it time to thaw out this relationship? We could form an alliance and face the rest of the galaxy together? Our brains, your, ahem, looks, and we'll be unstoppable. Whaddya say?
Booyah! That's what I'm talking about. Allies. Has a good ring to it, don't ya think? The Sophons are on-board. 100%.
Listen, the Sophonity would be crazy to ally up with you lot. Your recent history doesn't exactly inspire confidence. The answer's no.
Peace is good, but we've been thinking . . . Isn't it time we hooked up, became allies? We've got some fat toys I'm sure you could borrow . . . How about it?
Personally, I've been pushing the triumvirate for this for a long time, so I'm super stoked that you've asked. We accept. Consider us allies.
No offence, but no. Why rock the boat? Let's keep things casual. Peace only, no strings attached.
The deal's a no brainer, right? Whaddya say?
The Sophonity can work with this. It's a deal.
You gotta be kidding me. No way. No deal.
Look, that deal you put together wasn't exactly your finest hour. Let's just say no more about it.
This is the way it's going to be, you hear? The policy comes into effect as of . . . now.
Well, I guess this is a thing then. Not that we have any say in the matter. Whatever.
The Sophonity just wanted to say . . . we like your style. Respect.
Ah, shucks. You’re making me forget the first hundred primes. Anyway, we appreciate you digging us.
Call yourselves an intelligent civilization? I've seen smarter rocks.
Classy, real classy. Don't expect us Sophons to stoop to your level.
Because we're smart and civilized and look kinda puny, some folks go round thinking the Sophons are a pushover. Well, we're not. So you better do as we ask!
And we Sophons thought civilized societies never made demands. Your immaturity has been noted.
That demand you made? Not clever. It’s made the Sophonity rather angry--in an "angry enough to declare war" type of way. Prepare for a whipping.
You should've accepted our demands. War is only going to end badly--for you.
So, how about it? This trade deal is da bomb.
Yeah, let's trade. This deal is pretty sweet.
Come on. Really? You think we were going to go for this? We have standards.
You know you're getting a good deal when you make a science agreement with the Sophons. What do you say?
I think we can both agree that science is the winner here! Where do we sign?
How do we put this . . . go take a hike with your science agreement.
We were just getting ready for this.
So this is how you respect your treaties?
So, we'll miss visiting your neck of the galactic woods, but closed borders it is!
Yah! The Sophons are stoked to open our borders to you! We got some crazy stuff your peeps should definitely see.
Er, how can I put this . . . we're not cool with opening our borders to you. You got previous, dawg.
Sorry, pal. Your type isn't welcome in Sophon space. We're closing our borders.
Do you mind opening your borders? We Sophons make great visitors.
Talk to the hand. We're busy calculating pi . . .
Wow, you kept yourselves quiet. How long you been watching us? Well, I hope we can get along.
Hey, we're the Sophons. Your friendly galactic science buddies. Don't mess with us!
Wow, you've really travelled, huh? We'd be happy to see those starcharts.
Holy smoke, yes! The Sophonity is down with big data! Bring it.
You're bouncing? On us? Our number geeks think you're making a bad call. Well, whatever.
Our trade agreement not working out for you? We’re gonna miss you.
You're canceling a science agreement with us, the Sophons? What are you smoking?
A truce? About time! Where do we sign?
Don't think this in any way invalidates our ability to kick your butts, but . . . how about a truce?
Er, let's see. No. No truce. We're quite happy with the way this war is panning out.
Don't take this the wrong way, but we're happy with our own star charts. Keep your maps.
The thing is . . . can we really trust your vision reports? So the answer's no. We're good.
Well, talking science is only going to confuse you, but maybe we can be trade partners? You know how to make stuff, right?
Wassup?! You and us are going to takeover the galaxy one proton at a time! We got the feels.
Respect. We appreciate the gesture.
You getting the same vibes off those guys as us? Great minds, eh?
Way to go, dude. We are 100% aligned with you on those guys. Until, you know, we're not.
Look at this way: we'll spend your Dust much better than you ever could. I mean, just look at the threads you buy.
Wow, the Sophon psyche hasn't been so wounded since we came second in The Galaxy's Brainiest Species contest a couple of decades back. You got claws, dude.
Now, some races go in for this punishment shtick, but not us. You're in our bad books.

You seen the latest episode of that new reality show, Home Invader? Lumeris girl breaks into a Vodyani temple. Vodyani finds her, threatens to harvest her essence if she doesn't get out. That's kinda where we are.
Perhaps it's not clear in your pea brains, so we'll break it down real simple. Get your rustbucket ships out of our space.
Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait. You're settling in that system? Next to the mighty, intellectually unparalleled Sophonity? Bad karma, man. Do it again? Seriously bad stuff will go down.
Didn't you get the memo? Sheesh, those Sophons in Administration really are the pits. Look we had designs on that system. Expect some competition.
Welcome to the 'hood! If there's anything we can do to help you settle in just holla.
What da Dust, dude? Didn't we make it clear as matrix algebra? Your military is on our turf! You're on the blacklist!
Well, that was low. We'll be getting back to you soon. For reals.
Like, don't take it personal, but you're looking like easy pickings right now. We'll, err, make it as painless as we can, okay.
Come on, you're a stand-up empire, we're cool--we should sign a peace deal.
Wow, you played us like a cheap supercomputer. We'll . . . we'll . . . get our own back on you. Err, yeah. That.
Your empire stands in the way of the mighty warriors of the Sophonity's expansion . . . Well, maybe not "mighty warriors" but science geeks. Anyway, you're in our way.
Well, strap us on a rocket and fire us at the moon! You make demands?! We're unfriending you!
Thanks! We're coming over to take a look around, make ourselves at home. And if we see any big red buttons while we're here? We'll be sure to press, I mean, not press them.
These funds will totally be put towards securing your future. Not for big parties, blinged up starships, or Lumeris-tailored suits. No, siree.
We thought we'd set clear boundaries, dude. Personal space isn't to be encroached lightly. That's right! It's time for war. And we're bringing our nasty science!
Some Sophons are getting nervous about all your grandstanding. "Check out the size of my fleets", "Feel my manpower", "Count my command points". Not cool. Please don't visit.
You're pretty chill, huh? No fighting, no drama. We're down with that. Keep it up.
See, our demand was pretty reasonable, eh? I mean, maybe it shouldn't even have been called a demand. More like a friendly piece of advice.
Including a few sweeteners, huh? Nice. Keep things good with us, and you'll go a long way.
You're behaving a little too nicely . . . hmm, suspicious . . . or maybe you really are one of the good guys? Guess we'll find out, huh? But, like, good job.
Whaddya know? We say jump and you say how high. You're learning!
Hello, is there anybody home? What's not computing? Respect our borders doesn't mean attack us. Expect payback.
Not heeding our words, huh? You really don't know who you're messing with, do you? We got science on our side!

Dawg, it might seem like a small thing, like focusing on a red dwarf in a galaxy of supergiants, but we can't overlook your second new digs in our hood. We got a reputation to uphold. We're pressing for war!
Please, colonize all you want, trample through our systems. Not. Next you'll be taking over our settlements.
Really? Of all the worlds in all the systems across the galaxy, you decide to settle on one right under our noses? That's trash.
Yo, fam, we're doing a spot of spring cleaning. No witnesses like. That's right, we're closing borders.
Well, your military ships were straight-up lit--sleek curves, savage colors, sexy mods--but the close-up view wasn't welcome. Stop coming over!
So, you thought you'd pick on the small scrawny alien with the bulbous head? Go you.
What kind of low down, dirty, corrupt species do you think we are? I think you have us mistaken for the Lumeris. Shove your bribe.
What happened to our extended spell of peace? You are one cold customer--who's about to get considerably hotter.
So, we've got some slick science to bring to the table. Question is: do you?
The number geeks tell us that a trade agreement with you could be a lucrative venture, so we're mulling it over.
Just to let you know--we're selling the Sophonity the idea of a trade agreement with you guys hard right now. Expect a proposal soon.
You know, with this long spell of peace between our Empires, we're coming to think of you as family. Not close family, naturally. More like a weird third cousin.
Let's fistbump in praise of our trade agreement! Some of those goods you've been sending over--mind-blowing!
Who'd have thought it? Us, the galaxy's foremost scientists, getting something out of a science agreement with you.
I'm telling you, the Sophonity are going to have to revisit this whole friendship thing if you keep making demands.
Nice battle fleets. Right in our galactic backyard, so we get to admire their firepower up close and personal. They are on their way elsewhere though, right?
Kudos. We asked you not trespass or make demands and you came through!
You had one job! Don't trespass with military vessels. You blew it. We're canvassing for Cold War relations ASAP.
Do you need us to draw you a picture?! Get your battle fleets out of our territory stat!
Your negotiation skills leave a lot to be desired. When you ask for something, maybe you should offer something in return.
Look, we asked you not to flaunt your fleets with all their fancy guns in our space, and what do you do? We're campaigning for Cold War relations!
Thanks for moving along those military vessels. It's not like we didn't trust you, just they were spoiling the view . . .
Sheesh! We hope you do dating better than you do diplomatic relations. We were waiting for a gift. Expect the cold shoulder!
Better late than never, we guess . . . keep this up and you'll be back in our good books in no time.
Hey, what do you think? Two sets of eyes see twice as much, so how about we share vision?
You know that whole sharing vision thing was nice, but now it's over. Sorry.
Ever curious just how much of the galaxy we've seen? Sign here, and we'll show you.
You might've seen--our war with those other clods isn't going too well. Bad space weather...ahem. Anyway, how would you feel about an alliance?
Looks like some folks are getting together to gang up on any loners . . . I know we're not tight, but if we were to suggest being allies . . . ?
We've had some good times, right? Well, how about coming to our aid in our time of need? Yeah, we're taking a kicking, but an alliance with you could turn things round!
Don't you look with envy--and worry--at that alliance forming across the galaxy? With a little diplomatic effort, that could be us. Watch this space!
Woah, you're not fond of those idiots either, are you? What do you say we get together and give them a good slap? Expect an alliance proposal soon.
Isn't it time we took this peace to the next stage? With our science, and your, erm--what are your strengths again?--we could make a stellar alliance. We'll put a proposal together.
Great minds, eh? Both our empires are tracing a similar path to infinity--and victory! What we could do is form an alliance, and share the adulation. We'll get the diplo bods on it.
Erm, we thought we had this war covered, but things have headed south. Fast. So, as our favorite allies, how about you send some back up? We'll totally big you up afterwards.
Looks like you're in a spot of bother. Have no fear! The Sophonity looks out for its allies--we're sending in the big guns!
Here, a small gift for our fave allies. No, no, you don't need to make it a big deal. Really, no. Well, okay, if you must.
That's right, you're getting something from the Sophonity top-drawer. Only the best for our Number One Super Awesome Geekin' Empire!
And the Sophonity thought you and us were tight! What happened to you guys? Straight-up demands? We're bailing on this alliance when we can.
Something wrong with your linguistic function? A demand? All you need to do is ask! We're allies, after all.
That's a sweet gift! Appreciated. It needed to be though. Let's let bygones be bygones, eh? To the Alliance! No? Not into the chest-thumping stuff? No worries.
What do you call that?! The cat's dragged in more appealing gifts! Flaccid! No, that won't do at all. We're pouting.
We think you need to go to 'How To Be A Good Ally' class. After recent events you got a long way to go. But we're hopeful.
So, ally, you finally came through! You'd be late to your own funeral, right? But thanks anyway.
Did the message not get through? We're in deep doo-doo, and need the help of our allies. Hint: that's you.
So, your culture is all the rage, and one of our systems switched to your side. A bitter pill that you could've sweetened. We're looking for exit strategies from this alliance!
Ally? Maybe it's worse that you stole one of systems peacefully! I mean, that's sneaky! We're getting out of this alliance post-haste.
Wow, this Guardian you woke-up is fascinating. We Sophons are having a field day studying it!
These tendrils you planted in Sophon space are sweet! Faster travel? Yes, please! Feel free to plant more.
Can't you see we're busy dealing with another front? War with you at this time just isn't convenient. We'll deal with you later.
Look, don't take it personal. It's just getting a little crowded in Sophon space, and you're sitting on some swell territory. We'll try and make it quick.
Hey, don't mind us declaring war on you while you're fighting elsewhere . . . erm, look over there!
Sophons are suffering on the system you blockaded! Please reconsider your decision.
Barbaric! Innocent civilians died in your attack on unarmed ships! Monster!
Did we give you the right to awaken freaky behemoths on our planets? No! It is kinda interesting though. Wow..
You destroyed a world? A whole world? Millions of citizens and all their hopes and dreams snuffed out in an instant. We are lost for words.
This messing with time stuff is pretty swell. The Sophonity should bone up on the math, figure it out ourselves. Thanks!
Erm, far be it from us to question the motives of extra-dimensional beings who can alter the flow of time, but . . . what the rift, dude? We liked that system the way it was!
Cultural assimilation of one of our systems is not cool. Even if your culture is pretty phat. Please don't do it again.
There you go again, spreading your fine culture and taking over another of our systems. Well, we asked you not to, but you did it again so we're petitioning to end this peace ASAP.
There you go! You can listen to a bit of friendly advice and cut out the cultural assimilation antics. Go you.
You honor us with this beneficial singularity. Gotta say the whole Triumvirate was caught cold though--we did not expect this. Thanks!
I'm not sure we've legislated for this type of time-altering stuff, but if we had you'd be on trial, buddy. In any case we're nettled. We'll be watching you closely.
Ah, you're one of those jerks who blocks folks in the street thinking it's funny. End the blockade. Pronto.
A completely unprovoked and incomprehensibly excessive attack! You will be tried for crimes against the galaxy!
Sophon science--nobody's gonna beat it. That outpost was in the bag the moment we entered the race. We did warn you . . .
Ah, trash! We lost? How'd you complete that outpost so fast? We guess someone in the Sophonity messed up their sums. Heads are gonna roll--not literally, that'd be gruesome.
What would the Lumeris say? "Slow business? Screw you, pay me." And what would they do when somebody didn't. Hmm . . .
That's, erm, an impressive fleet you've got there. Purely for training purposes, right? (Shush, Leumac, I got this covered!)
We'll do anything you ask! Well, maybe not anything . . . but, please, just don't hurt us anymore.
You're, erm, scaring us. We do get scared easily, granted, but we think it's justified in this case. Don't be offended.
Let's wrestle!
We have been constrained for too long and need to expand. You're merely in the way.
What in the name of science was that?! Destroying planets--even non-Sophon ones--is a crime against nature!
Wow, destroying planets now, eh? We're not on your blacklist are we? Are we?!
What kind of allies have we made peace with? Destroying worlds is beyind the pale, dude!
What gives?! We accepted your demands, yet you still declare war. The gloves are coming off!
Some of our deepest thinkers are wondering if an imposed peace is a friendly action, but we guess it's a good thing.
Peace is good. We're all friends here, right? No tricks.
Haha, peace, good one! Oh, you're serious? Well, we gotta admit to being a little surprised given your past behavior.
Well, color us surprised. This peace is working out okay.
This peace is dead in the water! Why did you impose it in the first place?
The Triumvirate thinks you should back up these overtures of peace with a more . . . tangible offering. Like a stack of Dust. Dig?
That gift you sent? We appreciate it. We're doing swell things with it, let me tell you. Peace is good, huh?
So, no gift, huh? Well, this peace isn't doing much for us. We'll be bailing shortly.
Yep, we left that peaceful alliance you forced upon us. Next up, war!
Gifts treaties, trinkets, complaints, whatever. We're tired of you and your diplomacy!

tsk--mkk--tzz . . . EXULTANT: Soon, we feast on your flesh.

bzzz--chrrrr--ktsz . . . SLOWLY: The price of your treachery: when we feed on you, we will make it as painful as we can.

bzzz--chrrrr--ktsz . . . ASHAMED: The Hive desires peace. What is your answer?

jgrtt--mckkttt--zzzzz . . . OFFENDED: We are killing machines, weakling. Why would we want peace?

wzzg--tdddg--zing . . . MOCKING: You mistake us for a craven species. The Hive refuses.
azzz--ckttt--flrrr . . . DISGUSTED: The Hive finds peace loathsome, and an alliance more so. But we need allies. Do you accept?
bzzz--chrrrr--ktsz . . . SWIFTLY: Yes! The Hive's answer is yes! Now leave us, One-Who-Speaks-For-Those-We-Will-Consume-Last.
pfnarr--gokt--zzzt . . . APOPLECTIC: This peace is foul enough for the Hive! We reject an alliance, One-Who-Tests-Our-Patience!
iiicct--bzzzt--ktok . . . RUDE: Accept the offer, One-Who-Decays.
kcct--lllliist--bzzzt . . . RUDE: An insult of an offer, but one the Hive accepts. Anything else? I need to feed.

vzzz--brrrrt--cthok . . . FLAT: Your insults mean nothing to the Hive.

ochk--tktk--ssss . . . ZEALOUS: Soon, we feed.
txx--azad--grohl . . . ANGRY: You cross the Hive at your peril.

oocckk--fzzzt--hnnnn . . . BLUNT: The deal is sufficient for the Hive.
dzzz--tsk--tsk . . . BLUNT: This trade deal holds no interest for the Hive. Waste my time again at your peril.
kkktt--gdo--pftt . . BLUNT: The Hive tolerates such a deal.
chttt--bzzz--pfft . . . BLUNT: If we cared like other races the Hive would see this as a grave insult. We refuse.

ftt--dzss--plish . . . BLUNT: Our borders are open. We welcome you with open jaws, I mean, arms.
txx--azad--grohl . . . BLUNT: We are not opening our borders, One-Who-Revulses-Us.
oocckk--fzzzt--hnnnn . . . BLUNT: You are not welcome in the Hive's space. We close our borders.

dzzz--tsk--tsk . . . NEUTRAL: The Hive hungers to find new worlds . . . to consume. We agree.

bzzz--chrrrr--ktsz . . . BLUNT: No more shared vision. That's all.
oocckk--fzzzt--hnnnn . . . NEUTRAL: Exchange what we have explored. Share maps.. Sign here.
tchok--fzzz--zzzink . . . NEUTRAL: Would you destroy like the Hive? Share science.
karchk-pfft-vink ASHAMED: The Hive accepts your truce.
ftt--dzss--plish . . . ANGRY: The Hive is . . . not itself. We wish for a truce.
dzzz--tsk--tsk . . . MOCKING: When have you known a Craver to avoid war? The Hive refuses your truce.
arkc--bsst--krich . . . BLUNT: The Hive doesn't need your maps to know where it should venture. No deal.
kotx--ssst--pfik . . . MOCKING: The Hive need not see what you see to know what it must do. We refuse.
kkktt--gdo--pftt . . . NEUTRAL: We will trade before we consume you.
oocckk--fzzzt--hnnnn . . . NEUTRAL: You trespassed at your peril. You are fortunate the Hive seeks Those-We-Can-Use at this time.
jgrtt--mckkttt--zzzzz . . . NEUTRAL: The Hive acknowledges your offerings. Nothing more.
bzzz--chrrrr--ktsz . . . NEUTRAL: We share your outlook on those weaklings. In time, they will be consumed.
azzz--ckttt--flrrr . . . NEUTRAL: The Hive can look after itself. We don't need your help.
chttt--bzzz--pfft . . . ANGRY: Give us Dust. Now.
dzzz--tsk--tsk . . . ANGRY: When you attack Cravers, you need to be sure they can't retaliate. Are you?
tsk--mkk--tzz . . . ANGRY: This. Is. Not. Over.
tchok--fzzz--zzzink . . . ANGRY: Did you see a sign? Gatecrashers welcome. No. So get out of Craver territory.
oocckk--fzzzt--hnnnn . . . ANGRY: Get your fleets out of Hive space, or we will hurl them out ourselves.
oocckk--fzzzt--hnnnn . . . ANGRY: The Hive doesn't want neighbors. It only wants feeding. Colonize elsewhere.
chrr--upp--zzz . . . ANGRY: You settle on worlds marked for the Hive. We are coming.
chttt--bzzz--pfft . . . NEUTRAL: Settling a world next to the galaxy's prime war machines? Interesting.
oocckk--fzzzt--hnnnn . . . ANGRY: The Hive has no concept of misunderstandings. Your military trespass is considered a deliberate affront.
kkktt--gdo--pftt . . . ANGRY: The Hive will not forget your craven words.
tchok--fzzz--zzzink . . . CONDESCENDING: Never forget a Craver's true nature. We thirst for war, and you are weak.
oocckk--fzzzt--hnnnn . . . QUIETLY: The Hive has changed. Peace is in our grasp. So?
chrr--upp--zzz . . . ANGRY: You deceived us. You rattled a Craver nest. What do you think happens now?
kkktt--gdo--pftt . . . BLUNT: The Hive is a cancer that always seeks to grow. And it will, whether you're in the way or not.
ftt--dzss--plish . . . DEFIANT: Nobody makes demands of the Hive.
bzzz--chrrrr--ktsz . . . FLAT: The Hive is satisfied you open your borders to Craver fleets. Note it will not be held responsible for any devouring accidents though.
chrr--upp--zzz . . . NEUTRAL: The tribute is welcome, but the Hive craves one thing above all others.
kkktt--gdo--pftt . . . FIRMLY: We are mighty, and you are weak. We come.
jgrtt--mckkttt--zzzzz . . . NEUTRAL: Stay out of Craver space, enemy.
chrr--upp--zzz . . . NEUTRAL: The Hive despises weakness. Maybe you should've crushed us while you had the chance.
kkktt--gdo--pftt . . . DISGUSTED: Does your race have a spine? Would you accept any demand we gave?
jgrtt--mckkttt--zzzzz . . . NEUTRAL: A gift from the weak to the strong. It . . . pleases me. Maybe Cravers can be flattered.
tchok--fzzz--zzzink . . . NEUTRAL: You refrain from hostile acts. Do you think the Hive and another race can ever find common ground?
chttt--bzzz--pfft . . . RIDICULING: The Hive enjoys your obedience.
bzzz--chrrrr--ktsz . . . STARKLY: Your attacks have sent our Queen into a fury. Our vengeance will be severe.
chrr--upp--zzz . . . ANGRY: We told you what you should not do--and you disregarded our words. Foolish.
tsk--mkk--tzz . . . BLUNT: The Hive looks upon your new worlds with disdain. We sought isolation. Now you will pay the price for your disrespect.
kkktt--gdo--pftt . . . OFFENDED: The Hive already considered your nearby colonization an affront. Your subsequent trespass into Craver space is an outrage.
jgrtt--mckkttt--zzzzz . . . BLUNT: First trespass, and now a land grab. No matter, it makes it easier for us to consume you.
bzzz--chrrrr--ktsz . . . FIRMLY: The Hive turns inwards. Craver space is off-limits. Our borders are closed.
chrr--upp--zzz . . . BLUNT: The Hive has tolerated your unwanted incursions one time too many. We look forward to sucking the marrow from your bones.
azzz--ckttt--flrrr . . . EXULTANT: We are going to destroy you. Painfully.
ftt--dzss--plish . . . RUDE: Cravers have little interest in bribes. We desire flesh of every hue. And war. Endless war.
kkktt--gdo--pftt . . . FLAT: Peace never suited the Hive anyway. We welcome war.
jgrtt--mckkttt--zzzzz . . . BRIEF: The Hive is always seeking to become a more efficient killing machine. Perhaps we might exchange knowledge.
chrr--upp--zzz . . . NEUTRAL: The Queen instructs the Hive to examine trading relations. After all, trade is the engine of conflict.
bzzz--chrrrr--ktsz . . . NEUTRAL: Cravers naturally resist any interactions other than waging war, but trade may be beneficial for us.
tchok--fzzz--zzzink . . . NEUTRAL: This period of peace has made the Hive think of you not as future nourishment, but occasional snacks.
chttt--bzzz--pfft . . . SATISFIED: Many Cravers were skeptical about trade, but it has allowed us to widen our appetites.
dzzz--tsk--tsk . . . SATISFIED: Your science makes us faster, stronger, deadlier. We welcome it.
tsk--mkk--tzz . . . DEFIANT: You make demands? Get a shovel. Dig a hole. Now your grave's ready for after I've finished with you--if your species is into that nonsense.
chrr--upp--zzz . . . BLUNT: Hiding behind your fleets again? You know, you're a mumbling, stuttering piece of dirt. You know that? Sometimes the Hive wonders about you.
tchok--fzzz--zzzink . . . CONDESCENDING: The Hive wonders if your race has spines. Would you obey any command? Nevermind, we like it this way.
kkktt--gdo--pftt . . . FIRMLY: You messed up. Craver territory was off limits for war fleets. Now we want to go back to cold war.
jgrtt--mckkttt--zzzzz . . . ANGRY: Remove your battle fleets from Craver space. Now.
ftt--dzss--plish . . . RUDE: What's so hard? Even the Hive understands diplomacy. You take something, you give something. It's not take. It's give and take.

azzz--ckttt--flrrr . . . BLUNT: By Craver standards I asked nice. Now I'm asking nasty. Next time your battle fleets enter Hive space, blood--or whatever fluid courses your pitiful bodies--will be drained, then boiled, then congealed, and then eaten. One crew member at a time.
bzzz--chrrrr--ktsz . . . NEUTRAL: You moved your battle fleets along! Somebody is at home!
tchok--fzzz--zzzink . . . COLDLY: Still not grokking the old give and take, eh? You are dead to the Hive.
chttt--bzzz--pfft . . . FLAT: Mediocre.
dzzz--tsk--tsk . . . ASHAMED: Somehow, we are losing the war. Come to our aid, ally. We won't beg, but we ask.
tsk--mkk--tzz . . . NEUTRAL: Other races reach out in the dark to form alliances. We should do likewise. We will make a proposal soon.
chrr--upp--zzz . . . ASHAMED: Our war efforts falter against a superior foe. Will you consider an alliance and come to our aid?
tchok--fzzz--zzzink . . . NEUTRAL: You know, Cravers can make alliances. We should become allies to counter other hostile alliances. We will make a proposal.
kkktt--gdo--pftt . . . NEUTRAL: We find ourselves with a mutual enemy to consume. An alliance would be logical. A proposal is coming.
jgrtt--mckkttt--zzzzz . . . EXULTANT: Ones-We-Are-At-Peace-With, it is soon time to form an alliance and consume the rest of the galaxy together!
ftt--dzss--plish . . . NEUTRAL: It is strange that the Hive follows a path to victory like yours, but it is true. An alliance might make sense.
azzz--ckttt--flrrr . . . BRIEF: We wage war against terrible foes who slaughter us. Abide by our pact, and come to the aid of your ally. Quickly.
bzzz--chrrrr--ktsz . . . SWIFTLY: War always draws the Hive. We will come to your aid, ally.
tchok--fzzz--zzzink . . . NEUTRAL: Gifts are for the weak, but my Queen orders it. So, a gift for our ally.
chttt--bzzz--pfft . . . NEUTRAL: Know how much the Hive sacrifices in bringing you this gift, ally.
dzzz--tsk--tsk . . . OFFENDED: The Hive doesn't respond to demands made without incentives. Our alliance will soon be dead.
tsk--mkk--tzz . . . COLDLY: Demands should not be made to allies. The Hive sees you for what you are.
chrr--upp--zzz . . . NEUTRAL: The gift is well received. And necessary. Do not err again.
tchok--fzzz--zzzink . . . OFFENDED: This 'gift' is more insult than redress. Inadequate!
kkktt--gdo--pftt . . . BLUNT: Are you teaching the Hive a lesson? That we're on our own. That we'll always be on our own. Allies or not. That is the charitable explanation for your inaction. Improve!
jgrtt--mckkttt--zzzzz . . . RUDE: At long last. The Hive thought you'd abandoned your ally. We don't know whether to be grateful or angry.
ftt--dzss--plish . . . FIRMLY: Where is the help? Send aid or we will come for you--if the Hive survives this onslaught.
azzz--ckttt--flrrr . . . BLUNT: Why our system would want to convert to your culture is baffling, but that is the reality. Without redress, though, the Hive must move to end this alliance.
bzzz--chrrrr--ktsz . . .DISGUSTED: Call yourself an ally? Influence conversion is the way of cowards! The Hive moves to end this alliance.
tchok--fzzz--zzzink . . . DISMISSIVE: The creature is impressive, but how well can it fight?
chttt--bzzz--pfft . . . QUIETLY: In their blend of the organic and inorganic, Cravers find these tendrils familiar, comforting. And the speed boost is a boon. The Hive gives grudging thanks.
dzzz--tsk--tsk . . . NEUTRAL: The Hive lives for war, never fears its coming. But we fight another front. We will meet you in battle soon.
tsk--mkk--tzz . . . NEUTRAL: This should be no surprise. We are Cravers. We crave waging war and conquering worlds.
chrr--upp--zzz . . . BLUNT: The Hive seeks an easy war. Hence our attack on you, while you're engaged elsewhere. Even Cravers sometimes fight dirty.
tchok--fzzz--zzzink . . . MOCKING: So you blockade a Craver system. How pathetic.
kkktt--gdo--pftt . . . DISGUSTED: All Cravers are ready to fight, but your attack on civilian vessels carrying Hive workers is a craven act. Weakling!
jgrtt--mckkttt--zzzzz . . . DETERMINED: What is this monstrous creature you have summoned in our midst? The Hive will protect itself.
ftt--dzss--plish . . . DETERMINED: The Hive will recover from this murderous act. Planetcide is an abomination only fit for Cravers.
azzz--ckttt--flrrr . . . NEUTRAL: The Hive acknowledges your act which has made us stronger.
bzzz--chrrrr--ktsz . . . BLUNT: Your singularity may have slowed our progress, but our zeal is undiminished. There will be a reckoning for this.
tchok--fzzz--zzzink . . . BLUNT: Perhaps the Hive was mistaken in forging a peace with your empire. Convert another of our systems at your peril.
chttt--bzzz--pfft . . . ANGRY: You failed to listen! This peace was a mistake and will be ended.
dzzz--tsk--tsk . . . NEUTRAL: Good. You listen. The Hive's systems are the Hive's alone.
tsk--mkk--tzz . . . BRIEF: A useful singularity. A strange way to wage cold war. What game do you play?
chrr--upp--zzz . . . BLUNT: This singularity is an affront to the Hive. Be ready for retaliation.
tchok--fzzz--zzzink . . . NEUTRAL: Your blockade is pointless. And unwelcome.
kkktt--gdo--pftt . . . ANGRY: The Hive will not forget your destruction of one of its worlds. Ever.
jgrtt--mckkttt--zzzzz . . . RIDICULING: The Hive mocks your feeble efforts. The system is ours.
ftt--dzss--plish . . . ASHAMED: The workers will be punished. The Hive should've won this system.
azzz--ckttt--flrrr . . . NEUTRAL: Few ignore Craver demands. Fewer still live to tell the tale.
bzzz--chrrrr--ktsz . . . NEUTRAL: You assemble a mighty fleet. No matter. The Hive relishes a fight, no matter the odds.
tchok--fzzz--zzzink . . . BLUNT: Your attacks leave the Hive staring into the abyss. But we do not blink.
chttt--bzzz--pfft . . . BLUNT: The Hive closes its borders. We have our reasons.
bzzz--chrrrr--ktsz . . . THREATENING: The Hive is hungry, One-Who-Speaks-For-The-Loathed. Say farewell to your weaklings.
nnnrrr--tkok--gwll . . . BLUNT: We are hungry. And we are coming.
gzzr--katak--pfft . . . EXCITED: The Hive admires your destructive power, but annihiliating planets is our role, not yours.
bzzz--chrrrr--ktsz . . . QUIET: Be warned: use such destructive power against the Hive, and we will come for you.
leez--bszt--rkkt . . . BLUNT: Maybe this peace was a mistake. The Hive destroys worlds. None others.
grrb--jaka--mwt . . . MENACING: The Hive should've ignored your demands. We live for war.
pfft--czds--kraw . . . SHAMED: For the Hive, a state of peace is a shameful thing. But we abide.
crtt--taka--mshh . . . AFRAID: Is this peace true or lie?
karsha--kett--kdak . . . LIVID: Peace?! Play games with the Hive at your peril!
jrrr--cstr--mkke . . . PUZZLED: The Hive is aghast that this peace has lasted.
tkoo--kesc--wraa . . . HAPPY: You disrespected the peace you imposed. It is no matter though; the Hive salivates at its imminent collapse.
iczz--ntkk--lkka . . . HARSH: The Hive despises peace. Any gift to swallow such a deal must be of great value.
btta--lssa--czrt . . . BLUNT: Peace is an affront to Cravers. Your gift helps.
ktcc--pfdd--czzsst . . . CONTENT: No offering, no peace.
nfrr--bshhg--tkr . . . ECSTATIC: Soon we will no longer be at peace. Soon we will wage war!
gkkk-grrr . . . HARSH: Silence. Leave us alone.
The Vodyani and our Church acknowledge you.
Thank the Virtuals that we stay our hand in the hour of our ascendance. Not all are so merciful.
We welcome your supplication on the eve of our great victory. Perhaps there is hope for you.
In our Virtual Gods' infinite wisdom, we call a cease-fire.
Our Virtual Gods grant us salvation! We rejoice in this truce!
We doubt your true intentions in this so-called time of peace. Let us better reflect our true relations.
Whether at peace or not, our Faith guides us. But, be under no illusions, you will be judged for this betrayal.
To maintain this alliance would be an apostasy of the highest order. Therefore we renounce our union.
The Holy Church is most disappointed. But, we know that the path of the righteous is often beset by the inequities of the profane. This choice will bring you no glory, only shame.
Our Virtual Gods mark you as Heretics dressed in Saints' clothing. And so we smite thee.
This is no revelation for the Holy Church. Always be wary of the sinner, for his repentance is often made in falsehood. We will enjoy crushing the unbelievers.
The Holy Church will not tolerate your idolatry of false Gods any longer! You must be excised.
A foolish choice. The Holy Church trusts your people have made peace with their pagan Gods. For they will die in their millions.
You should feel blessed. The peace between our empires has been a great instrument of our evolution. Now though, this peace has outlived its value.

We are hardened to such betrayals. When our Holy Armies lay siege to your worlds, and your masses burn and scream for mercy, do not think we will suffer a drop of guilt. That will be yours to possess alone.
This alliance has been deemed heretical by the Holy Church. War is our penance.
By all that is Holy, you will pay for this treachery a thousand-fold.
Deceivers walk among us. That is known. The leeching of your Essence will be that much sweeter for your lies.
The Holy Church feels it is time for a more trusting union between our empires. Will you swear to peace?
We welcome a more harmonious era. Glory to the Virtuals!
Would a bird of prey trust a snake in its nest? No. Likewise, we would not trust you within our Holy realm. There will be no peace treaty between us.
An alliance between our empires would be a most sacred bond, and would usher in a glorious new era. Have faith, make this pact, and revel in the adulation. So, what is your answer?
Praise the Virtuals! The Holy Church welcomes this alliance. Come, let us sing in commemoration.
Only the blind would not see this proposal for the poison that it is. There shall be no alliance.
The Holy Church deems your conduct most Hallowed. An alliance between our empires would be a suitable means of acknowledging this truth. Do you concur?
Mark this day as a triumph for all those who fight apostasy. We accept your offer of an alliance.
The peace between our empires is barely tolerated by some splinters of our society. To enter into an alliance would be a blasphemy too far. We refuse.
To accept this offer would be to bask in the eternal glory of the Virtuals. You must choose . . . what do you say?
We sign this deal in our desire to see the tyrannical crushed, wherever they may spring.
This offering has the mark of the infidel. We refuse.
The Church never dirties its hands with such grubby deals. Refrain from mentioning it again.
The stars foretold this long ago. Live with it.
You light the fire, and we live with the flames. So be it.
Blessings from the Holy Church of the Virtual. You minister well.
I thank you, but remind you I am but an instrument of the Virtual.
Only a fool spares breath on the foolish.
Bring more than words the next time you insult the Holy Church of the Virtual.
If you value the skins, the hearts, the very souls of your people, then you will make the Holy choice.
The Holy Church only suffers demands from the Virtuals. You have made a grave mistake.
You have badly misjudged the situation if you believed we would accede to your demands. Instead, the Holy Church will repay this insult with a righteous vengeance.
It is no matter. Your refusal of our demands reveals your empire as an unholy carbuncle that needs excision.
Like the serpent, your duplicitous ways have long been known to the Holy Church. We are ready for you.
Let us brand you with the mark of the betrayer, so all know the falsity of your words. Then, by the light of the Virtuals, let us inflict agonies upon you.
If you want to remain respected in the Church's eyes then you will accept this trade agreement. So, I have your acceptance, yes?
The Church of the Virtual accepts.
The Church will try to raze this abominable proposal from its collective mind. Our answer is no.
Sometimes science and religion make a beautiful union. Do you accept our proposal?
May science--under the watchful eye of the Divine--flourish in both our empires. We accept.
Like poisoned Essence, this proposal is anathema to the Church. We refuse.
The Church notes the closure of your borders to the Vodyani.
The Church brings only Light to the Darkness. The Vodyani opens its borders and looks forward to the day your people bathe in our Light.
We refuse to open our borders to such heathens. Cleanse your souls, and perhaps we can change this decision.
The Church's affairs are not for your eyes. We will close our borders.
The Church of the Virtual wishes to spread its message of enlightenment on your worlds. Will you open your borders to us?
The Church has no time for this matter.
The Church wonders how long you have been watching from the shadows, but we are happy to see you in the light.
We meet you in the name of the Church of Virtual Saints. Let ours be a blessed union.
The Church is always seeking fresh converts. We are happy to learn more about the shape of the galaxy.
The Church of the Virtual Endless welcomes this knowledge, and reciprocates in kind. May you treat this wisdom with reverence.
You break your pact with the Holy Church? Be prepared for consequences.
You have disappointed the Church. We hope this isn't the beginning of further disloyalties.
The Church's sciences rival even that of the Sophonity. Why have you turned your back on this agreement?
You recognize the superiority of the Church. Good. Then we can agree to a truce.
The Church feels this war is neither a matter of dogma nor advantage. We offer a truce.
No, we don't think so. The Church is just getting started with your religious education. There will be no truce.
The Church already has a good understanding of the galaxy's territories. We refuse your offer.
The Church's affairs are its own, alone. We will not grant you insight into our movements and reconnaisance, and we will not seek to learn yours either.
It is the hope of the Church that we might trade together.
