It is good to see potential friends--and converts--in this vast galaxy.
The Church appreciates your good efforts, and looks forward to good relations.
Please note that the Church shares your opinion of certain other species in this galaxy.
Your great efforts to maintain the equilibrium have not gone unnoticed by the Church.
To support the faithful is a great though expensive task for the Church. It seems only right that you help donate.
You have injured that which is holy, and the Church takes offense.
Your acts of barbaric cruelty have inflamed the righteous anger of the faithful!
You trespass upon sacred space, and the Church of Virtual Saints insists that you leave.
If you do not leave our sacred space on your own, the Protectors of the Faithful will eject you. Forcefully.
Though your desire to live in proximity to the Church is commendable, we cannot accept a colony of infidels so close to us.
Your selection of systems for colonization is understandable. Do not be surprised if the Church makes the same choice.
While the Church welcomes converts, unbelievers like you who invade neutral territories are less welcome.
You seem to feel it is not a problem to send military fleets into the sacred space of the Church. But the Church does not agree.
Perfidy and treachery are sins that live long in the memory of the holy Church.
Your refusal to build defensive capacity shows that you care little for your territory. The Church would be pleased to take it from you.
The Church seeks more time for prayers and less for battle. We would propose peace between our nations.
The Church is ever vigilant against demons and deceivers; you behave like they do and risk being treated the same way.
As with all living things the Church seeks growth, new territories, and opportunities. Your attempt to limit this will not end well.
Your desire to extort the Church seems the act of a faithless unbeliever, not a friend.
Praise thee. Let the free flow of ideas, faiths, and goods bring our peoples together.
Your donation to the coffers of the Church is blessed in the eyes of the Virtuals. We thank you.
The Church must expand, or fade. As it would be blasphemy to fade, our legions shall expand.
The faithful feel uneasy with your growth and power; the Church aims to close its borders to ease their worries.
As long as your acts of aggression do not target the Church, we shall assume your intentions towards us are peaceful.
We understand that at times the faithful must accept a greater burden for the good of the holy Church.
Your generosity and wisdom are noted by the Church, and will be looked upon kindly by the Virtual Saints.
The Church appreciates your peaceful behavior; our previous suspicions of your hostility have been greatly reduced.
The Church welcomes the wisdom of your actions, and your acceptance of your place.
You have committed violence against our Cloth and our Vessels! What shall we tell the faithful, who demand retribution?
You treat our sacred territory as if it is your own? The anger of the faithful cannot be contained eternally.
The Church's warning for your transgressions has been ignored. Perhaps you will understand other, more aggressive, avenues of communication.
Why is it not obvious to you that the holy space of the Church is sacrosanct, and your presence defiles it?
Your colonization within our sacred space is viewed by some faithful as an invasion. Is this what you intend?
Do not feel offended that the Church closes its borders to you; sometimes the faithful feel the need to meditate and pray in peace.
Your relentless trespassing with military vessels will end as it inevitably had to: with your destruction.
The Church is curious as to why you decided to attack us; we see this as unprovoked violence from an unbeliever.
Do not insult the purity and probity of the Church by trying to purchase our integrity or good will.
The Church's response will be severe for this betrayal of our peace. You will never forget the searing fire of the Virtual Saints.
The Church's natural philosophers make great strides in deciphering the Virtuals' glorious machines. We are considering sharing our sciences for your own learned studies.
Trade is a somewhat sublunary affair, unworthy of the Church, but it has its uses. We are considering proposing an agreement.
The Church proselytizes to the faithful of the value of trade with your empire. A proposal is coming.
Your idols are false ones, but this extended spell of peace has given us much common ground. The Church values our bond.
Some call it a heresy, but this blossoming of trade has between our empires has been a blessing.
Granted, your sciences have given our philosophers much to ponder--and our faithless much to rejoice--but undoubtedly, our insights have been even more enlightening and beneficial to you.
You should be careful as to the target of your demands. The Church rarely responds in civic fashion to ultimatums. Especially from brethren.
The glory of your military fleets cannot match the glory of the Church's. You would be wise to move them out of Vodyani space so as not to tarnish their reputation.
We should not have had to ask in the first place, but the Church welcomes your observance of our edicts on trespassing and making demands. Carry on.
The Church places great stock on its right to seclusion. Your military trespass tramples roughshod on these desires. You should expect a thawing of relations.
Let me be clear. Any further persistent presence of your military vessels in the Church's holy territories will be met with the wrath of the Virtuals.
The wise offer alms before they make demands. Make amends and put something in the collection plate.
You continue to trespass in the territories of the faithful at your peril. The Church will preach for a return to cold war.
The absence of your war fleets from Vodyani space is welcome. Keep it that way.
The Church held out its collection plate in a gesture of good faith, yet you still don't offer alms. Expect retribution.
You cannot take back your insolent demand, though your gift begins to make amends for your oversight. The Church stays its hand.
The Church offers that you share our holy vision. Perhaps you will even see the light of the Virtuals.
We do not like where you cast your eyes. The faithful do not trust you; our vision sharing agreement ends.
The Vodyani have seen much and traveled far. Would you wish to share maps?
Help the Church survive this war and you will have our eternal gratitude. We will not forget.
The galaxy moves. Alliances form. We should too. What would you think of an alliance with the Church?
The Church wages war against the infidels, but the price is high. Will you be our savior in our time of need? If we proposed an alliance . . .
Unbelievers rally together. We must stand together and be strong together. My inquisitors draw up an alliance proposal as we speak.
A darkness spreads among the stars. You know their name. Why don't we come together, scorch them with the burning light of our righteousness? Becoming allies is all it takes . . .
This peace between us has pleased the Church. Soon we should deepen our bond, become allies.
It seems we follow the same path. Perhaps we could share victory? After all, we need not draw the essence of every living creature in the galaxy. All it would take is an alliance . . .
Heretics threaten the Church's very existence! Be swift, ally, and help smite our enemy.
An attack on our allies, is an attack on the Church. Stay strong, the Virtual Saints are coming to give succor.
On our Arks we sing daily hymns to your magnificence. A small token of our appreciation.
We can give you nothing more precious to relay the sanctity of our bond. We hope you understand.
Poisoned words from poisoned hearts. A gift might've sweetened things, but you elected to give nothing. Our alliance will soon be dead.
You obviously misunderstand how the Church operates. Never do we look kindly upon demands.
Your gift to the Church is well received. May it augur more friendly actions towards your ally in future.
This gift is an insult to the Church.
With allies like yourselves, who needs enemies? The Church is wary.
Is late better than never? The Church hopes you never have to rely on such an unreliable ally in your time of need.
The Church notes the pedestrian nature of your response to our request for help. Remember the Church has a long memory before you make your final decision.
The Church takes a dim view of others converting its flock. Especially when it is not accompanied by an adequate gift of compensation. We will dissolve this alliance at the earliest opportunity.
Theft is theft, whether it is done peacefully or violently. This alliance will soon die the death it deserves. Adoration to the Saints!
Vodyani scholars are still assessing the Guardian's provenance--and therefore, its doctrinal worth. For now, its presence is accepted.
Your tendrils are fascinating. Some speculate a connection to the Virtual, which would only add to the wonder of their speed-enhancing creation. Blessings.
Fear not, the Church will give your fleets the fiery attention they deserve when we have dealt with the other infidels. Then you might rise up, Virtual.
The blazing Light guides us. Your territory belongs to the Holy Church. You should feel blessed.
The Church strikes when it is advantageous to its interests. You are fighting elsewhere, thus it is an advantageous time. Why are you surprised?
Do the innocents not deserve ministration? Then end this cruel blockade.
The Church saves its most searing wrath for this heinous attack on innocent civilians. War is no excuse. You will burn for this.
This creature you have raised from the depths of our earth is an abomination.
Rest assured, all those souls lost in the destruction of our world will be avenged. The Church is set on this path.
Scripture has no mention of any singularities, but it is always easier to accept new things when they are a blessing and not a curse. The Church is thankful.
We see the hand of the Deceiver in this time trickery. You intentions better be pure, lest you risk the wrath of the Church.
The Saints would be aghast at this cultural assimilation to which you subjected our system. Do not repeat this act.
It seems you were deaf to our ultimatum of desisting from cultural assimilation. The Church wonders if you will be likewise blind to the end of our period of peace when it comes?
Praise the Saints! We find sense in the darkness! The Church applauds your refraining of the practice of cultural assimilation on our flocks.
Adoration to the Saints! An unexpected blessing. This Church-affirming singularity has been deemed Holy.
The Church deems this act an apostate one. We will observe your next actions with great interest.
Blockades are such a tawdry choice. The Church had higher hopes for you.
This wanton destruction is an abominable act! We will avenge our lost souls. For the Virtual Saints!
Competing with the Church is often an exercise in pointlessness. What we set our hearts to, we receive. Our new colony will flourish.
We are chastised. Those responsible for our failure to claim the system will seek penance. The Church offers congratulations on your victory.
A request by the Church for tribute is not one to be ignored lightly.
Your forces are close to the Church's sovereign space. And we do not forgive those who trespass against us.
Your attack on the Church only strengthens our resolve. Think carefully about your next move.
It is a time of introspection for the Church of the Virtual Saints. We close our borders. Do not be offended.
The Virtuals have spoken. It is time for our fleets to plague your worlds.
Our Most Holy Arks are ready to expand into new territory. Your territory.
The Church views your wanton destruction of a whole world as an abominable act. We will seek your repentance.
The Church sends generous praise after the mighty demonstration of your power. May the Virtuals guide you!
We may be at peace, but your reckless attitude to other worlds runs contrary to the teaching of our great Church. We worship life.
Your declaration of war after our acceptance of your demands gravely insults the Church. Expect no mercy.
Be careful. The Church of the Virtual Saints takes umbrage at things forced upon it—even treaties of peace.
The Church is surprised at your imposition of peace. Do we no longer need to fear your wrath?
Let me be clear. The Church does not exist for your base entertainments. This peace you force upon us better be genuine.
The Church is pleasantly surprised this peace has lasted. Don't let that give you the impression we are letting our guard down though.

Those who join the Church in peace should understand that it is only the beginning of a deeper union. You have not kept that faith, and as a consequence we will be dissolving this peace in short order.
Prove that you want this peace! Offer something for the Church's collection plate--like Dust.
The Church applauds your wisdom in furnishing us with such a gift. Here's to a long and prosperous peace.
The Church has lost patience with your failure to deliver a gift. Our peace will soon be a thing of the past.
The peace you forced upon us will soon be shattered. Ponder on your mistakes swiftly, for soon the Church will have its retribution.
The faithful tire of your incessant pestering. The doors of the Church are closed to you.
I greet you in the name of the Four Families.
Now that we have demonstrated our military superiority, perhaps we can go back to doing business?
So, you've come to the understanding that you will never win this war? Good.
The Lumeris are a proud race, but not stupid. We have lost this war. We call a cease-fire. Maybe we can make some trade deals now?
You are gracious in your ascendancy. Maybe we can return to more profitable endeavors now?
The Families have spoken. There can be no peace between our empires when you act like this. It is time for colder relations.
The Lumeris have a saying "From bad blood comes bad business." Mark our words, this change will not be a profitable one.
Honeyed words spill from your lips, but your actions are poison. We might as well have a union with the Cravers. This alliance is over.
We see no reason for your mistrust, but the decision is yours. We hope to return to more prosperous times in the future.
Enough of this farce of a cease-fire. You crave war, so war is what you shall have.
The Families always had their doubts about this truce. And so it comes to pass. Don't expect us to be merciful on the battlefield.
As the minnow becomes the shark, so mistrust becomes hatred. Come then, let our empires slip the snakes of war.
Your declaration of war is no surprise to the Families. Let us play the deadly game then.
You shouldn't have confused the loyalty of friendship with the bond of blood. It's not personal. It's strictly business.
The Families will remember this deceit. One day, when you think this insult long forgotten, we will come for you.
You should've known, Ambassador. You keep your friends close, but you keep your enemies closer.
You learn! Real power can't be given. It must be taken. Let's see if you can take it then.
War . . . War never changes. Do you think someday there might be a generation who can forge a lasting, eternal peace?
For business to flourish we need to enter more hospitable relationships. Will you sign a treaty for peace?
The branch of peace is welcomed by the Families. May this be the beginning of more profitable times.
Let me tell it to you straight. Go shove your peace deal up your darkest, dirtiest orifice. Are we clear?
The Families see no need for this distrust. An alliance is in both our interests. Come, let's sign a deal.
We welcome this alliance. Be warned, though, if you come to our table with malice in your hearts, our vengeance will be severe.
This proposal is an insult to every Lumeris. You must think us stupider than the stupidest Craver soldier-caste. We refuse.
The Families agree. These peaceful times are fertile ground to plant more fruitful seeds. An alliance, then?
An alliance is good for business. And the Lumeris are in the business of business. We accept.
The Families have examined all the angles. An alliance could jeopardize other . . . interests, so our answer is no.
The Families were in good spirits the day this deal was discussed. We are confident you'll find this a very generous offer. So, are you in?
As long as you don't pull any tricks, this is a deal we can get behind. Let's do it.
This is what you bring to our table?! Our ancestors would turn in their sea graves. Get outta here!
You come back more often than barnacles. We have other things to do!
This is the way the Families do business. Don’t like it? Take a hike.
So, that's how you do business? Be ready for consequences.
The Families send compliments.
The Families recognize your kind words.
Call yourselves a galactic player? You're an embarrassment to all space-faring civilizations. Now go and get your shine box.
Please, don't hold back. The Families will remember every word. Every word.
It is better if you think of this not as a threat, but as a request that you should take under consideration.
You come here with demands, you better be ready to back them up with actions.
We could simply refuse your demands, but you must understand that we have a reputation to uphold. War is the only logical response.
The Families believe you make a grave mistake. Much blood will be on your hands.
Business is war. Didn't they teach you that? The Lumeris is always ready when enemies attack.
The Families are most disappointed. Your lack of respect will not be forgotten.
Trade is our lifeblood. You would be wise to accept our proposal.
Is there anything saltier than a freshly inked trade agreement? The Families accept.
This trade deal is worth less than a piece of rotten kelp. Come back when you have something substantial to trade.
The Families think you will find this science agreement most agreeable. Do you accept?
Open the finest wines! The Families accept.
This deal needs to sleep with the fishes. Capiche?
Open borders are the lifeblood of trade, but sometimes there are higher priorities. We accept your closed borders.
The opening of our borders to you can only be good for trade. Let's celebrate with a little Dust . . .
What can I say? Your actions have made us reluctant to open our borders to you. Deal with it.
The Families are all about business, and business dictates we close our borders to you.
Let me tell you, you will not regret opening your borders to the Lumeris. So, what's it going to be?
Get out of my sight.
You have the Four Families on the back foot--normally we choose the time and place for introductions.
I am the leader of the Lumeris. I greet you in the name of the Four Families, and hope we can do business.
Trade will be so much easier with the galaxy mapped. We accept.
Business is always better when in possession of the facts. We gladly share with you.
Lumeris intel not good for you? Well, the Four Families won't lose much sleep over this.
Canceling a trade agreement with the Lumeris is like cutting off one's own crown jewels. Not smart.
Too bad. Let's face it. We're not exactly known for own scientific prowess. We leave that to lesser races.
The war hasn't been good for business. The Families are happy to sign a truce.
Tell me again, why are we fighting when we could be trading? What do you say to a truce?
The Families have a reputation to uphold. No truce.
The Families are happy with their current view of the galaxy. An exchange of maps would not be profitable.
The Families feel adequately appraised of others' movements around the galaxy. Vision sharing will bot be necessary.
Greetings to you, fellow explorer! It looks like we'll have many opportunities to trade!
Let us hope that our relations go well--and profitably.
We like the way you think; it bodes well for both our fortunes.
Apparently you share the opinion of the Four Families with regards to other empires.
You did some very nice work there! The Four Families salute you.
Building empires, creating trade routes… It's all quite expensive, and we feel you could chip in.
When you hurt one Family, you hurt us all. And we don't forget things like this.
The Lumeris will not stand for this sort of savagery!
We thank you to trade outside our borders. Internal commerce is for us.
Enough poking about in our business! Leave the Families' territory to us.
You're muscling in a little too hard on the edges, friend. That colony is in our space.
You think that's a nice place for a colony? Funny, so do we. Hi, neighbor.
You want to come and settle in the neighborhood? Sure, no problem. Plenty of space.
It's one thing to send cargo ships, but those are military--and we don't want them here!
You have crossed us. And the Four Families take vendettas very seriously.
Don't be angry; you'd do the same thing in our place. It's just business.
Whoa, let's not get too excited over all this. How about we try again, at peace?
I thought I didn't have to watch my back around you. I am sad to see that I was wrong.
You might as well put a noose around our neck as a colony in the middle of our trade route!
That's dirty work. Back alley stuff. We really don't appreciate that.
Bravo! You open your arms and your borders to friends! Especially friends with an eye for business.
We're glad you see the Families' side of things. Trust us. You'll be very happy you did this.
Hey, if we stay small-time we'll fade away. The Four Families have to grow, and you're stopping us.
We may just have to cut off some deals and clam up. The big, wide galaxy is looking a little hostile.
We were thinking you're a little crazy; bad for business. Maybe we were wrong, and that's good.
We're glad to see you're reasonable people. That's promising for our future.
A little cash on the side to provide proper incentive? Sure, we know how the galaxy works.
We're hoping we'll work out our differences. So far it's encouraging. No bad blood.
We're happy you saw the sense in our request. No hard feelings, right?
You don't seem to understand. You come into our home, make trouble. That's not good.
So you insist on hanging around, causing problems? We have ways of handling problems.
What do you want? We told you no more colonies near us, and you ignored us. Don't act surprised if it gets a little ugly.
Hey there! Back off a little. We were pretty clear. What part of "leave" did you not get?
Our planets, our system. This is our space. We don't need your colonies here. Get it?
Sometimes the Families just need to pull back and think. So we're flipping the sign to "closed for business".
You had one job! Keep your shooters off our patch. And you screwed it up. Don’t be surprised if things get personal.
Hey there! What was that for? Do we come into your neighborhood and bust up the windows?
Sure, you say it's just business. But there is some business we don't need.
I must be going crazy. My advisors tell me your empire has declared war on mine. Tell me there's been some mistake, otherwise you will pay.
Our whale brains have been busy. They've invented some very nice tech. Very nice. Do we share though?
Trade. It's in our very blood. And you could be our next lucky partner. We just need to sell the idea to the masses.
Sweet, sweet, Dust! It's out there, just waiting to be taken. And we've chosen you to help us take it! Watch this space. A proposal will be on its way soon.
How long have we have been at peace? Long enough to call you stand up guys.
What did we say, huh? Trade is good for business. Stars, trade is business! Salut!
The Families enjoy the fruits of our mutual scientific labors. Life is good.
Nico Arrakyo had a friend who made a demand. That friend is now plankton feed at the bottom of the ocean. You catch my meaning?
You've got some big fleets with nice guns. You like to come into our neck of the galaxy, show them off. Big deal. Now jog on.
Whaddya know? You listen! No trespassing. No demanding. You're headed for the big time.
Your military fleets are in sovereign Lumeris waters. This lack of respect isn't to go unpunished. The Families want to return to cold war.
The Families won't ask again. Remove your military vessels from Lumeris space or something very sharp is going to get shoved somewhere very soft.
Where the Families are from there are two circumstances where a chum can make demands: when he brings a gift or when he has the bigger stick. You got neither.
Get your junk ships out of Lumeris territory! The Families canvas for cold war relations.
You moved your fleets on. Yeah, yeah, yeah, slow claps, backslapping, all those theatrics. Don't let it happen again.
Where's the positive gesture? Did the delivery guy get lost? We've got squat at our end. The curtains are coming down on our dalliance.
You call that an overture? Arina Meos once received ten thousand sea roses in recompense of a minor slight. That's an overture. But I guess yours will do.
We got a deal that's a little different. What do you say we share ship and system vision?
Sometimes business is good business, sometimes bad. The vision sharing thing is now part of "bad".
You want to see something that you're guaranteed to like? Let's try sharing our maps.
We're in a tight spot. The war isn't going too well. Whaddya say you help us out? We could be allies.
The Dust--it's out there just waiting to be taken. Are you bold enough to take it? Cause if you don't others will. Alliances are forming already--and we want to do the same.
We've had good times, no? Now we're in a pinch are you going to step up? We need allies to win this war.
You see what's going on elsewhere? Deals, alliances, profit. We've had peace. Now we need to build on it, take the business to another level. We're going to propose an alliance.
Neither of us like those guys--you know who I'm talking about. Why don't we team up, take them out the game? We'll drum up support, send a proposal soon.
The Families always had a good feeling about you, and so it's proved. You've earned your stripes. Whaddya say we take this to the next level now? An alliance. We'll put something in writing.
The future looks golden--Dust-infused you might say--for both our races. How about we plan to tag-team to victory? All we need to do is make an alliance . . .
Yeah, this is when you step up, show your friends you mean business. So, are you going to help us win this war?
Relax, the Families are on their way. We look out for our allies.
Lumeris hospitality right there. Enjoy the gift, ally of the Families.
We're sending the finest stuff for our best ally. Don't forget who sent it.
You disrespect the Families with this unsweetened demand. Our alliance will soon be over.
Only deadbeats make demands. Show some respect!
Better. The gift makes amends--just--for your earlier slights. The Families hope you've learned your lesson.
Your gift is about as valuable as chum. We suggest you up the ante if you don't want to cause offense.
I've seen more helpful buckets of chum. Ally? Don't make me laugh. We needed you and you did squat. Do better or watch your back.
Ah, you do remember what allies do! Thanks for the back-up--even if it was late.
Am I talking to myself? Are you listening to me? The Families need some muscle and as our dear ally you're first up. It's like dominoes. We topple, you're going down too. Get over here.
Refresh my memory--did the Families invite you, an ally, to takeover one of our systems? At no cost? No. This alliance will soon be dead.
You're on real thin ice. This Influence conversion? Peaceful, my tailbone! The Families will move to end this alliance.
This Guardian creature--it's a money-making opportunity, right?
To be honest, these space tendrils are a little creepy to us, but faster travel means bigger profits so we're golden. You wanna plant some more?
Guess the Families are going to have to deepen the war chest to take care of multiple fronts. We'll get to you in good time, don't worry. The Lumeris remember their enemies.
What can we do? You're sitting on some prime galactic real estate? It's just business.
What? When should we go to war with you? When you're ready to give us your full attention? We ain't stupid.
And it's the little people who suffer. That blockade is a low blow.
I'm telling you, I better not learn that any family was aboard any of those civilian vessels you attacked. You'll pay in kind.
What is this creature you've awoken? The Families don't like it.
The Families had a particular fondness for that world. Mark my words, the galaxy will know of your utter barbarity.
You got some skills with time, eh? Keep it positive and we won't have a problem.

Yeah, so you can manipulate time. Big deal. We got a way of manipulating time for folks too. We kill 'em, and then they don't experience nothing. You should think carefully whether you want to keep this singularity on us.
How can any culture be greater than the one that raises the theater to the highest form of art? I don't get it. Anyway, refrain from any more Influence conversions.
What did I say? What. Did. I. Say. WHAT DID I SAY?! Refrain from any more Influence conversions. And what did you do? We're going to end this peace.
Whaddya know? You can listen! No Influence conversions since I asked. Now, if I asked you to give the Families a million Dust . . .
You know, the Families wonder what you want throwing around these helpful singularities? But, thanks, I guess.
Tell me--do you see the Families coming round your home and adversely screwing with your perception of reality? No. Cause we don't.
A blockade? Seriously? Are you an empire or a two-bit pirate outfit?
You. Will. Pay.
Ah, too bad for you. Maybe you weren't paying your outpost crew enough? Cheap.
You win some, you lose some. That's investment. Don't worry, the Families are still in the game.
You know what happens to chum who don't pay their graft? Horrible, you-wouldn't-let-your-children-watch type stuff. Understand?
Now, now, now. You send in those fleets sitting on our border, and we're not going to be able to trade. Wouldn't that be a tragedy?
That attack was out of line. What did we do to you? You'll stop there, right?
Yeah, we're closing shop. No hard feelings. A boss has to do what a boss has to do. Just business.
What do you want me to say? The Families have okay'd limited hostilities. It's just business.
You're sitting on some prime galactic real estate. The Families want a piece of it. It's just business.
What insanity is this? The destruction of entire worlds goes against everything we stand for. There will be consequences.
Let me be clear: using such a weapon against the Families would not be in your best interest. Please remember that the next time you take aim.
Understand, we are a race of traders. Destroying worlds is not something we expect a peaceful ally to be undertaking.
The Families will long remember this duplicity. Let us have this war then!
Nobody likes to have something imposed on them—even peace—but we will not fight this.
Good. Now you have imposed peace between us, we can proceed with more profitable ventures, no?
Peace? Really? We'll see, but know that we Lumeris are masters of these political games.
This peace between us seems stable. Perhaps we were too hasty in imagining its swift demise.
What purpose does peace serve if it doesn't further the ties of trade? For your lack of respect, the Families intend to leave this peaceful union shortly.
The Families expect this dour peace to be sweetened. A little sprinkling of Dust wouldn't go amisss, would it?
Well, well, well. The gift is an unexpected pleasure. The wheels of trade have been well oiled. Peace suits us.
Without the necessary incentives paid, the Families deem this peace worthless. Expect it to end soon.
Our peace will soon be over, and war will come. The Families will have their vengeance.
You have the depth and worth of a shallow puddle. We've had enough of talking to you.
In the name of the Heart and of harmony, the Unfallen greet you.
Scouring you with the Fire-that-Destroys was an unfortunate necessity. We would prefer a truce.
The Unfallen stand resolute before your fires. The offer of a truce is wise.
Your machines of Fire grind us down. The Unfallen must request a truce.
Your temperance demands our respect. The Unfallen are pleased to accept a truce.
Your acts are not the acts of one who seeks harmony. We must step away from Peace towards Cold War.
You would ignore our desire for harmony, and drive the Unfallen from Peace to Cold War?
We had great hopes for this alliance, but your actions have shattered them. We are driven to Cold War, and await the inevitable.
We are confused; the Heart is angry. Why would you drive us from a harmonious alliance to Cold War?
Clearly you do not understand the point of a truce: To promote peace. You desire the Fire-that-Destroys, and you shall have it.
You choose to war on the Unfallen, rather than seek the peace that is best for all living things. So be it; we too know the uses of Fire.
Though the Heart weeps at this decision, it is a necessity. The Unfallen must turn this Cold War into a hot one.
Your decision weighs heavily on the hearts of the Unfallen. So be it; prepare to be ravaged by the Fire-That-Destroys.
It takes great effort to drive the Unfallen from an agreeable peace to the horrors of war. But you have made these efforts, and then some.
If you are capable of committing such an act, perhaps our treasured Peace was entirely without hope.
The Heart weeps for broken dreams and shattered hopes. You have made a mockery of our good faith alliance, and the consequence is war.
What you do would be called treason if we did it to ourselves. You shatter our harmonious alliance; prepare, in turn, to be shattered.
As you know, the Unfallen would prefer peace. Let us see what this war brings you.
We hope to bring our peoples to a closer harmony. Would you consider Peace over Cold War?
The Unfallen are not a people who reject the branch of peace.
In spite of our preference for peace, we see that you are not truly prepared to shoulder that responsibility.
Would you not prefer to share the risks and challenges of the future with us, rather than rattle sabers and stab each other's backs?
The Heart always prefers harmony to discord, and peace to war. Regardless of how it is offered, the alliance is accepted.
This is too great a leap to take, even for an ideal that we cherish. The Unfallen refuse your offer.
The Unfallen are unanimous in the desire to deepen the harmony of our relationship. We accept.
Do you not wish to improve the warm relations between our peoples? Let us ally and face the future in harmony.
Though the principle of your offer pleases us, the Heart is unprepared to engage in a relation so intimate.
The Unfallen have an eternal quest to seek peace and harmony for all peoples; this is merely one step along that road.
Your proposal pleases the Heart, and the Unfallen are pleased to accept it.
We cannot accept your proposal, for it requires too much compromise of our principles.
There are many greater tasks the Unfallen must complete; we are sorry, but yours does not merit our attention.
Sadly, but fortunately only rarely, the harmonious goals of the Unfallen must be imposed.
This was not expected; the Unfallen are taken by surprise.
The Unfallen praise you as fellow travelers toward a more harmonious future.
The Unfallen are pleased that you share our vision for the galaxy.
You are not worthy to share space with the Unfallen; we would not trust you to shovel loam.
Like storms of hail or dust, your words are best ignored for the excess wind that they are.
It pains us to act unilaterally, but we feel the greater harmony is better served by our demand.
Your demands are unpleasant. Do not forget that trees are long-lived and resistant.
You have sent the spark that fans the flame. This time, it is the flames of war and the Fire-That-Destroys.
Do not mistake a desire for peace and harmony for a fear of conflict. You will find us prepared and united.
It is a form of sharing, and a way of increasing our mutual trust. Let us trade, and communicate.
The Unfallen are pleased to forward our goal of harmony, through diplomacy or commerce.
The terms you propose do not seem equitable and just; the Unfallen refuse your trade deal.
The Unfallen have knowledge and wisdom you would be wise to share.
The Unfallen and the Heart welcome all those who wish to exchange ideas and dreams.
Whatever advantage you may see for yourself, the Unfallen see none. We do not accept your science proposal.
You would bring Fire to the cold war we now know? The Unfallen are unafraid of the heat.
A descent into violence from truce? It saddens the Heart, and steels the resolve of the Unfallen.
We have much to exchange; your closing of borders promises chaos rather than harmony.
The Unfallen have nothing to hide; our borders are open, and we hope that your hearts are as well.
Occasionally the denseness of the forest makes it impenetrable; our borders will remain closed as well.
There is a sense of unease and disharmony that causes the Heart distress; we must close our borders and see to it.
We would move among you as friends, and trade among you as partners. Shall we open our borders to each other?
The Unfallen are occupied by affairs of greater importance.
It is always a pleasure to find new peoples and new civilizations to join with. May our future be harmonious and fruitful.
Greetings from the Unfallen and the Heart that is our guide. May our future be harmonious and bounteous.
The Unfallen are not afraid to share their wisdom, or their maps, with those of good faith.
The Unfallen propose to share our knowledge on the shape of the galaxy.
You would sever our ties, bind our eyes? The Unfallen are dismayed by your action.
We traded more than simple material wealth; the Unfallen are dismayed at your decision.
We are surprised that you would cut yourself off from the wisdom of the Heart by ending this science agreement.
Let us improve the harmony by sharing our vision. It is a first step to a greater understanding and mutual appreciation.
There is a difference between seeing and spying, and to the Unfallen you prefer the second. We will no longer share our vision of the galaxy.
A map of the stars is like a great puzzle waiting to be solved. Let us share maps, and unravel these secrets together.
We are an ancient people, and know much in the way of science and history. Would you enter a scientific agreement with the Unfallen?
We accept this truce and the harmony that it confers.
War is such a destructive force. We offer a truce. Will you take this branch of peace?
Sometimes it is necessary to burn before one can build. This is such a time. The Unfallen reject your truce.
We hold ancient maps that echo with tales of the past. But they are not for your eyes. Keep your star charts.
We Unfallen wish to extinguish the flames, not fan them. No good can come from sharing what we both see. We refuse.
Greetings! Proximity encourages trade, trade encourages communication, and communication encourages harmony.
The Unfallen greet with pleasure any vessels that come to trade in peace.
The Heart is touched by your gesture, and thanks you for your kindness.
We find harmony in our opinions of other peoples, which is promising for our mutual future.
The Unfallen appreciate and condone your actions towards the less civilized of the galaxy.
Maintaining peace and harmony is difficult and expensive; it is in your interest to aid us in these efforts.
Your actions are not those of an empire seeking harmony and a common future. We will remember this.
Slaughter of the defenseless can never be condoned! Your actions put you at risk.
We prefer to keep our territory, like our forests, pristine and free of outside interference. Leave, or suffer.
It is unwise to attempt to trample us with your fleets; you should fear the Fire-That-Destroys.
We keep to ourselves and do not trample your fields. Keep your colonists out of ours!
You are not the only one who extends their tendrils to other systems. Do not be surprised if we arrive as well.
We welcome peaceful relations, neighbor.
Our relations were cordial, even harmonious. We do not understand why you send fleets of Fire to threaten us.
We do not submit to this type of diplomacy; do not start a fire unless you are ready to be consumed.
It is against our principles to bring the Fire-That-Destroys upon others, but sometimes the Heart makes demands that we cannot refuse.
The Unfallen always prefer peace to other, colder relations. Time has passed and scars have healed; shall we think of peace again?
In the greater galactic community, where all peoples strive to rise and survive, leaning upon each other, you have just committed treason.
You wall us in, block our roots, cut off our light. The Unfallen cannot survive, locked in a corner. Give us room to breathe.
We are surprised that such positive diplomacy on the surface hid this attitude, rotting out our relations from within.
The Unfallen appreciate your gesture, and shall treat your space as we would have others treat ours.
Your gesture and generosity have been noted; we hope that the harmony need not be disturbed again.
The pressure of growth, natural as it is, must take its course. This course passes through your space, unfortunately.
Movements in the galaxy become tense and temperatures rise; we close our borders before the heat turns to fire.
The Unfallen note some measure of restraint on your part. Hostilities were not pursued and this is good; the Heart hopes that it will continue.
We would not have demanded if it were not necessary; we thank you for accepting it and maintaining a balance between us.
The benevolence and generosity of others is always a sign of positive, harmonious relations between honest peoples.
Perhaps the Unfallen watched and mistrusted too much. The Heart recommends we prepare for improved relations and greater trust.
We regret the use of such crude instruments, but the Unfallen found it necessary to get the message through.
You appear to think that the Unfallen do not wish to protect our forests--be they literal or figurative. You are wrong; prepare for the Fire-That-Destroys.
We do not tread in your fields and carve paths through your forests. Yet you do the same to us. The Heart turns cold.
A second time you have refused to respect our space. The Heart is disturbed by your intrusions, and we will oppose them vigorously.
Your continued intrusions and offenses have set fly a cloud of sparks. The Fire-That-Destroys can not be too far behind.
You colonize our territory as if you owned it. You do not, and if we must shatter the harmony to teach this lesson we will do so.
We have managed to close our borders; do not take it as an offense, but the Heart turns to its own well-being.
Your displays of aggression and armed threats cannot be ignored forever. You wished to shatter the harmony, and you have done so.
I see a "cold" war is not hot enough to you. You may wish to change your mind when the Fire begins to burn you.
The Unfallen do not accept these bribes. They smell of duplicity, treachery, and dishonesty.
The sadness of lost harmony is felt deeply by the Heart. We fear that you must be destroyed if we are to rediscover that situation.
There are secrets and sciences that the Unfallen know that may be of interest. Mutual sharing could be a first step to deeper collaboration.
The Unfallen feel that we have grown and prospered; we would share the bounties of trade with those we see as friends.
The Unfallen rely on trade as a way to extend greetings and build harmony between peoples. Would this be of interest?
Our long and peaceful relations are a source of comfort for the Heart. The Unfallen treasure your contribution to galactic harmony.
Our mutual trade has been good both for the wealth of our civilization and for the harmony of the galaxy.
The sharing of knowledge is a key first step to mutual understanding. Our science agreement has been a source of contentment for the Heart.
The Heart is troubled by your unexpected demands. As friends, you could simply ask.
The Unfallen note the beauty of your military fleets, but wonder why they are so eager to wander in a friend's territory.
Your dedication to maintaining harmony between our peoples by keeping your fleets away and easing your demands is greatly appreciated.
We had hoped for greater restraint on your part. Once again your military trespasses, and the Heart turns cold.
The Unfallen insist on the removal of your ships from our territory. Immediately, for the Heart is greatly upset.
The Unfallen understand that you have needs, but a more harmonious gesture would be to offer something in return.
Your continued military presence worries the Unfallen. Even the Thirds become concerned, and our relations risk degrading seriously.
The Heart appreciates your gesture. A lack of military presence brings greater peace of mind.
You refuse the reasonable request for harmony posed by the Unfallen. We doubt your intentions, and our friendship fades to twilight.
A small gesture, even if late, is better than nothing. The Unfallen are reassured by your harmonious intent.
The peaceful realm of the Unfallen is threatened by the Fire-That-Destroys. We look to friends in our time of doubt.
The Heart feels the alignment of hostile forces, bent on destroying the equilibrium of the galaxy. Perhaps it would be wise for our peoples to counter that weight.
Our long and peaceful relations contribute to a feeling of trust. We are pressed by those who are enemies of the harmony, and must reach out to friends.
The Unfallen greet you; we are gladdened by our peaceful coexistence. As enemy alliances threaten the harmony, we look to friends to restore it.
Our mutual desire for peace is threatened by a common enemy. The Heart would have you as an ally to counter this threat.
Our empires have seen harmonious peace for many years. We consider you an ally in thought, and consider making you an ally in deed.
Our great peoples forge on the same path to a similar goal. If we were to join forces, that goal could be more easily obtained.
As ships of Fire lay waste to our peaceful citizens, we look to our allies to aid us in our time of need. Will you help restore the harmony?
The Unfallen cannot stand by while an ally burns; we shall honor the letter and the intent of our alliance with what aid we can give.
The Heart is moved by the depth of our alliance. The Unfallen offer you a gift of appreciation.
Your friendship is valued in this turbulent galaxy; in honor of our alliance the Unfallen give you a gift we view as highly valuable.
Such demands go against the sense of harmony and the intent of our alliance; as the alliance has lost its meaning the Unfallen should leave.
Why would you make a demand of allies? This lack of integrity wounds the Heart and offends the Unfallen.
Your generous gift has greatly moved the Unfallen; once again we appreciate the depth of your commitment to our alliance and our cause.
The Unfallen note that you have made a gesture, but it appears cheap and paltry. You put the alliance at risk.
Your past indifference to the Unfallen caused great pain to the Heart. But the Unfallen grow, and think, and can even forgive.
Your support and aid come in a time of need. The Unfallen are content that you remember our alliance.
You burn bridges and alliances with your actions. The Unfallen do not offend easily, but you have managed to do so.
The Unfallen also understand natural growth, but yours is predatory. You do not compensate or apologize; our alliance is an empty shell and will soon crumble.
Did you not understand our request? Or do you care so little for our alliance? You feed upon the Unfallen systems, and in doing so you break our alliance.
This is a great omen of peace and harmony for our alliance! The growth of a Guardian is a joyous thing.
Together we grow, and our alliance flourishes. May our tendrils entwine in ever-greater harmony.
The galaxy dissolves in Fire and violence. The Unfallen are beset on many sides, but each flame shall be doused in turn. Yours will come.
The Unfallen are driven to breathe and to grow; constrained as we are we will die if we cannot expand. This war is a war for survival, not conquest.
The Unfallen see that you already take pleasure in fire and violence; we shall declare war on you now that it may end that much more quickly.
You take pleasure not merely in war, but in torture. Why must you starve and bleed those who are blameless with your blockade?
The Heart is stunned and inconsolable. You slaughter the innocent and burn that which did not harm you.
We did not expect you to uncover a Guardian upon our soil. Normally we would be overjoyed, but with this the Heart is troubled.
Your thirst for planetary destruction will not be forgotten; not while the youngest of our Firsts becomes the oldest of our Thirds.
The Heart marvels at your mastery of the things we thought to be immutable! Our thanks for your time wizardry.
We do not understand why you play with time and make the Heart beat slower. This is not an act we expect of a friend.
Your hunger for systems seems excessive. We do not oppose growth, but your acts are not those of a civilization that treasures peace.
We see that your claims to be peaceful were at best misleading. The Heart no longer trusts you, now that you have devoured our system.
Your hunger for our systems seems to have been sated. We are glad that you respect the harmony.
Your singularity is a positive sign to soothe our chilly relations. The Unfallen appreciate your gesture.
You seem to desire to wage war with things other than the Fire-That-Destroys. Whatever the tools used, your intentions are clear.
The Unfallen would call this an act of war. Blockades do not signal an intent to improve the harmony of our relations.
This is not an act of cold war, but a hot-blooded act of savagery! You would ruin the foundations of galactic civilization with your planetary destruction.
The Unfallen flourish, and our outpost joins the Heart. We did not intend to offend or annoy you.
The Unfallen withdraw, for the outpost is lost. We hope your hunger does not prove insatiable.
We did not feel the demand of the Heart was unreasonable, yet you refuse tribute. Your choice seems threatening.
Our interest is in peace and harmony, yet we see you massing fleets on our border. We trust you are not savages who revel in fire and blood.
You burn and brutalize with abandon. The Unfallen are not a threat to you; why would you drive us to extinction?
The Heart is concerned about the affairs outside our borders. We are forced to close them and take counsel.
The Unfallen intend to defend the Heart and our civilization. If we must drive you off, we will do so.
The Unfallen cannot live in a galaxy so wracked with anger and madness. Our only hope is to bring it under our control, and teach it harmony.
How can peace come to the galaxy when you destroy worlds in a churlish fit of anger? The Heart is unsettled.
The Heart is troubled by your violence. We beg you do not turn your worst weapons on our worlds.
If war to you means being ready to destroy worlds with unstoppable fires to ensure victory, then maybe this peace was a mistake.
We met your demands, yet you declared war. We rail against your deceit, but the Heart still counsels peace. If we must wage war, let us make it brief.
The Heart rejoices at our peaceful entwining, but the song is tempered by the knowledge this peace was forced upon us.
With the roots of our empires entwined in peace, we pray for a more harmonious relationship. One based on respect not fear.
The Unfallen will never turn from the branch of peace, imposed or no, but the Heart counsels caution. We watch you closely.
The Unfallen take great strength from our abiding peace. We confess to having doubts, but you have kept your word. Stay true.
The Heart is always most pained when a peaceful ally betrays those intentions. Peace is a mighty word, but words are only wind. Deeds matter. Soon the Unfallen will break this false peace.
Do you desire peace, truly? The Heart demands a gesture of good faith: a gift of Dust. Rest assured it will be used for peaceful endeavors.
The Heart is blessed. We thank you for your gift. May this peace flourish.
The absence of a gift saddens the Heart. The path to galactic peace is long and shadowed; our peace will soon splinter.
Peace must always be chosen freely. Forcing it upon us was your mistake. Prepare yourself for war. The Heart has spoken.
The Heart sees no interest in your words, and little warmth in your heart. We have nothing to say to you.
The Empire welcomes all who embrace its ideals.
After your humiliation at the hands of our brave armies, you should be thankful we offer a truce.
A wise choice. The courageous armies of the Empire were ready to smash your pitiful forces.
I am a prideful man, but not so proud to be able to admit defeat. The Empire seeks a truce.
The Empire is a slumbering giant. You are sensible to desire a truce while you appear to be winning.
All my Dukes agree with me. The Empire cannot tolerate an illusion of peace, while you agitate for war.
The Empire long remembers other nations' slights against its character. This is a dark day. For your people.
I take this written Alliance, rip it up with my bare hands, and spit on the pieces! The Empire readies itself for the slightest provocation for war!
Be very clear, this action will not be forgotten. One day your empire will lay begging at the Empire's feet, and it will take all our restraint not to crush you under our heel.

The Empire hoped to teach you peacefully, but I see that my Sheredyn generals were right. I Maximilian Zelevas, First of the Patriots, Bearer of the Iron Hammer, Supreme Authority of the United Empire, declare war.
Ha! You dare to declare war on the mighty United Empire? Pure of heart and mind, soon my brave patriots will drive your fleets against the hard rocks of bitter defeat.
Long have I dreamed of this day when the Empire will send its forces to crush your craven and immoral ideologies. We are at war.
Foolish. I, Maximilian Zelevas, Supreme Authority of the United Empire, have raised million-strong armies, smote all my enemies, and united worlds. Why do you think you will be any different?
I. Don't. Like. You.
You play a dangerous game. The clang of hammers in my shipyards, the march of my armies' boots, and the sounds of your people's screams--all this will be music to my ears soon.
Come, don't be so shocked. We play the game of realpolitik, no? You've known all along this alliance could never truly last.
You make creditable opposition, attacking in the midst of an alliance. We would do the same. Do not expect this declaration of war to end well for you, though.
War . . . War never changes. Do you think someday there might be a generation who can forge a lasting, eternal peace?
The Empire admires your leadership, and the course you chart for your people. We propose a peace treaty for our mutual benefit.
The Empire welcomes the offer of peace from a nation of like-minded patriots.
This Empire is built on the principles of order, respect, and discipline. We cannot be at peace with you and your rabble.
Stand proudly! Let us forge an alliance that will be the envy of the galaxy! What do you say?
The Empire doesn't enter into alliances lightly. Don't make me regret this decision.
The Empire refuses. End of story.
All the Empire's Republics agree. Your people make fine patriots. Let us deepen this peace and forge an alliance.
With your courage and our steel, we will forge a mighty alliance. I will appoint a fine Sheredyn to head up the transition team.
The Empire will not ally with the likes of you. Be thankful we remain at peace.
Is there no finer smell than the sweat on a man's clothes after a hard day's labor? Come, sign this deal while my spirits are so high.
A fine vintage to toast a fine deal, I think! The Empire accepts your proposal.
No, this won't do at all. With this proposal you spit in the Empire's eye.
You are worse than my damn sister! Stop bothering me with things of no consequence.
The Empire will always come first. This is how it is.
A most . . . interesting choice.
The Empire salutes fellow patriots. Exaltations.
Keep your actions as honeyed as your words and we will have no problems.
There is more worth in the most diseased rat from the lowliest slum of Raia, than the entire sum of your empire.
Know that this slander will be repaid in full. And not with mere words.
I recommend that you agree to the Empire's demands.
You make demands of the Empire? You know who makes demands? The weak. The strong simply take.
Who are you to make demands of the Empire? This insolence will be met with violence, so you might think twice next time.
As you wish. You will find the Empire's fleets strike as hard my words.
The Empire is a civilization forged in the crucible of battle. If you think your declaration of war frightens us, you are very much mistaken.
War. Truce. War. Truce. The Empire is happy you show your true colors.
The sound of industry echoes through the Empire. We have much to trade.
This trade deal will be a boon to both our empires. We accept.
You want to trade worthless things, while the Empire offers riches. There is no deal.
Science will be the fuel that powers the Empire. We accept.
Go offer your primitive science to the Kalgeros. They might find some use for it.
Closed borders? The Empire is never disappointed to close its borders. We accept.
The Empire agrees to open borders, but be sure not to pry where you are not welcome.
The Empire has internal affairs to attend. We refuse the offer of open borders.
It is time for the Empire to put its house in order, educate a few errant Dukes. We close our borders.
Open borders will allow our empires to thrive. I have your agreement, no?
The Empire has nothing to say at this time.
You have done well to remain hidden from the Empire for so long. Now, though, is the time for us to forge great feats together.
We are the United Empire, and we come to tame the stars. Do not stand in our way.
The Empire spans many systems, composes many patriots. We are happy to share maps, but do not make designs on our territory. That will end badly.
It is always good to know the movements of less patriotic peoples. They can become . . . problematic if not carefully watched.
You have slighted the Empire. We hope, for your sake, that you didn't take this decision lightly.
It is no matter. The Empire will find more loyal trading partners.
The Empire's science base is second to none. You are foolish to walk away from this agreement.
Yes, enough blood has been spilled in this bloated war. I will sign the truce.
This war only weakens both our empires--to others' advantage. We offer a truce.
A truce? No, I, Emperor Zelevas cannot be seen to be weak. I am the first of the patriots. Tear up your truce.
The Empire's stellar cartographers are second-to-none. I would not insult their work, by taking your no doubt slapdash maps. The answer is no.
Ah, to see what you see would be tempting, but the insight you would have into my own fleets' movements makes this proposition untenable. The Empire declines this offer.
The Empire is an industrial powerhouse. It would be a shrewd move to become our trading partners.
The Empire feels that our interests are mutually aligned. We could forge a strong friendship, and build a great future.
The Empire admires your gift. Such leadership is to be applauded.
Bravo! We find ourselves possessing a similar outlook on many of the galaxy’s other races. Perhaps we share other tastes . . .
As my Counts and Dukes will tell you, words of praise rarely leave my lips, but your recent deeds have earned my grudging approval. Here's to you.
You are in debt. To us. Pay up or face severe consequences.
Foolish. Very foolish. When you cross the Empire you should be sure to eliminate any possibility of retaliation. Our vengeance will be severe.
Some say the measure of a civilization is the way it treats its most vulnerable. When the Empire has swept up your people, you will see that we can be merciless.
You tread on very thin ice. Withdraw your fleets from Empire territory immediately. Failure to comply will result in severe consequences.

To see a creature flayed alive, to see the icy fear in its eyes as it understands the exquisite pain it will soon feel--that is true power. Get your fleets out of Empire territory, or you will be that creature.
Perhaps I have not made myself clear. The Empire is building a great future among the stars. Settle another system in the path of our expansion and your empire will suffer.
Haha! The Empire has great plans for that system. Soon we will found our own outpost, and the race will be on!
The Empire examined that system and deemed it . . . inadequate. You are quite welcome to it. Good luck.
This act of military trespass will not go unpunished. Where, when, and how we will retaliate will be for us to know and you to find out.
Once one of my personal guards thought he could steal from the Emperor. I cut off his right hand, threw it to my dogs. Today he is my most loyal guard. Your empire will suffer a similar fate.
The strong dispose of the weak. It has always been thus, and it will always be thus.
Come, let two glorious empires sign a pledge of peace!
So, you play the friend, but underneath lurks the snake. We will not forget this lesson.
The Empire has a great future. Vast fleets, glittering worlds, a thousand billion patriots across the stars. And our path to this future? Blocked by your careless wanderings. So move.
Give me, give me, give me . . . before I united the Empire a rival Duke was always making deceitful demands. When I became Emperor I had him hung in front of the Imperial Palace. Be warned.
The opening of your borders is a generous act. We will be respectful when we visit.
The Imperial coffers welcome your generous donation. It will not be forgotten.
The time for diplomacy is over. We cannot tolerate such aggressive expansion into Empire space. Prepare to be crushed.
My scouts tell me that you agitate for war. For this reason, we intend to close our borders.
Your peaceful approach to the Empire has not gone unnoticed. I have ordered that you be awarded the Purple Falcon for services to the galaxy.
You are wise to accept our demands. I am not a man who responds well to refusals.
A favorable contract. Well played. The Empire always looks out for those races that understand they shouldn't test our patience.
Perhaps you are playing the long game, but at this moment I commend your hospitable actions. I will send a bottle of my finest palinka.
The Empire is happy that you can obey instructions. Make sure I don't need to make any ultimatums again.
You have failed to obey a simple ultimatum. Worse, you attack innocent Empire forces. Our retaliation will be swift and terrible.
Your actions bring your empire perilously close to ruin. I would be very wary of my next move, if I were you.
You have greatly misunderstood the patriotic fervor of this great Empire if you think another nearby colonization will not go unpunished. Prepare for war.
You are a brave soul to trespass in Empire space so flagrantly. Brave and foolhardy.
Be warned--don't be surprised when we pay your latest system a visit. After all, it is on our doorstep. It won't be a neighborly visit, though.
The Empire turns inwards to address home matters. Please leave our territories.
I have grown tired of your provocations, the sightings of your bristling vessels close to Empire population centers. Desist. Now.
An attack on any Empire citizen or unit is an attack on the entire Empire. I recommend strengthening your defenses.
Your bribe is an insult. For your benefit, I will pretend this never happened. Next time might be different.
The Sheredyn hawks counseled that you could not be trusted to keep this peace. They were right. Now you will feel the Empire's vengeance.
Our Mezari traditions ensure the Empire's sciences are strong. If yours are likewise, it may be time to sign a science agreement.
Expansion and exploitation never come cheap. Perhaps we should sign a trade agreement soon to fuel our empires?
The Empire is used to building and fighting. Trading with others is not in our blood, yet it could benefit us. A proposal will come when the patriots are convinced . . .
It is time you came to the Imperial Palace as an honored friend of the Empire. We will drink brandy, smoke Lumeris cigars, and indulge in other, darker, pleasures.
Wealth flows into the Imperial coffers! All patriots rejoice.
My chief scientist, Petra Mandzukic, informs me that her teams are learning much from your sciences. One day we might make you an honorary patriot!
Let me tell you the thing about demands. Friends don't make them. And if they do, they make sure they can enforce them. Can you?
Tell me, what purpose does it serve to parade your battle fleets through a comrade's territory? Do you want marks out of ten?
I think I'm beginning to take a shine to you. No trespassing? No demands? I might not need to attend tonight's executions to stay in a good mood.
Tut, tut, tut. You've been caught somewhere you shouldn't have been. Hold out your knuckles. Or whatever you have that passes for knuckles. It's cold war time.
Hmm, correct me if I'm wrong--though that's rarely the case--but didn't I tell you to remove your military forces from Empire space? No, don't answer. I did. GET THEM THE HELL OUT! NOW!
Didn't I already tell you about demands? Show some respect. Make a gesture.
The Empire doesn't speak with traitors. Yes, I'm talking about your fleets' persistent trespass. Diplomatic privileges will be withdrawn shortly.
You've removed your trespassing battle fleets? Good. Better. I hope I don't have to ask again.
No gesture, then? Have it your way. Our peace accords will be ripped up shortly.
Some say it's the thought that counts. That's weakness talking. Like your gesture. But anything is better than nothing.
Let us share our vision! Not of the future, but of our ships and systems.
You see too much, and reveal too little. We do not trust you, and cancel our shared vision agreement.
A galaxy this vast requires many eyes to fathom its secrets. The Empire proposes that we share maps.
The Mezari scientists of the Empire are famed; perhaps you would like to share in our knowledge.
Will you come to aid us in our time of need? Are you a patriot? The Empire considers offering an alliance.
Look how the other half of the galaxy conspires together. Isn't it time we forged an alliance? We will make a proposal.
Our peace means a lot to the Empire. We come to think of you as fellow patriots, helping to make the galaxy great again. You would fight alongside us, no, if we offered an alliance?
Is it not time to forge a deeper bond between our great nations to counter other axes forming across the galaxy? Our peace should beget an alliance. Be ready for a proposal.
I see we share a common enemy. Wouldn't it make sense for us to cement this peace with an alliance so we might smite our foe together?
We should drink to our peace! One shot for every year! Listen, friend, soon the Empire will propose an alliance.
We walk a common path--one of righteousness and valor. Wouldn't it be wise to find victory together as an alliance? We will send a proposal.
It is a dark time for the Empire. It is time the Empire called upon its allies' aid. We are expecting you . . .
The Empire sees that you need help. Don't worry, we will come.
A gift for our great allies--and a reminder of your allegiances.
The Empire does not give such gifts to any ally. Know what this means to us.
I think I might be repeating myself, but I will say it anyway. Demands should only be made by those who can enforce them. This alliance will soon be over.
You know, you look very ugly when you make demands. Perhaps it is the distaste you feel when making demands of an ALLY!
Your gift warms the heart of every patriot across our mighty Empire. I offer you a full pardon for your previous actions.
A gift? This is more like something my dogs might drag from the canals.
Call yourself an ally? You've proved yourself as useful as my third-born. And equally unexpendable. The Empire tolerates our alliance.
Ah, now you offer your ally assistance. Well done, you.
Your disdain for our alliance has been made quite clear.
Whether through force or assimilation, the Empire takes the theft of its systems very seriously. Without recompense for this loss, we move to end this alliance.
Allies do not take from each other, peacefully or not. I know full well what to do with an ally such as yourself; uniting the Empire taught me that. This alliance will be ended soon.
Haha! A mighty patriot to inspire the Empire! We will drink to this Guardian!
As long as these tendrils remain benign, I welcome their presence in Empire space. Faster travel is a great boon.
A treacherous act, but not one that unsettles the Empire. I have fought wars on multiple fronts before, and I will do it again. Your time in our crosshairs will come.
The path to the Empire's victory sometimes skirts others' lands and sometimes tramples right through them. This time it's the latter. Consider it an honor.
The Empire cannot wait for you to resolve your petty squabble elsewhere. We declare war on you.
My people suffer! Only a monster would blockade a system during a time of war!
We will etch the names of the dead on memorials up and down the Empire. None will be forgotten in your butchery of innocents.
What is this "Guardian" abomination that you raise up from Empire land? You transgress the conventions of war at your peril.
Arghhhhhh!!!!! A plague of pestilence and misery on you and all your worlds! For this destruction, I will have you flayed and hung!
I do not know what sorcery this is, but the Empire welcomes the effects of this singularity.
Your temporal witchcraft is unappreciated. What are you up to?
A strong Empire should conquer--not make gains through the duplicitous act of cultural assimilation. Convert another of our systems at your peril.
Am I speaking to an imbecile? Do not convert Empire systems, I said! This peace will soon be over.
You are wise to refrain from any further peaceful assimilations of the Empire's systems. Carry on like this and we have a future.
You call this a singularity, eh? I am not sure I like the means, but the ends are well received.
My distrust of this time-mangling sorcery seems well founded. Stay on this path at your own risk.
This restriction on Empire movement is unacceptable! Think very carefully about continuing this blockade.
The Empire will never forget this colossal atrocity.
With the fire of the patriotic in our hearts, the Empire was always going to win that race.
You won the outpost race. A lack of steel accounts for this humiliation, and those responsible will be punished. Do not expect us to repeat this mistake.
Where is our tribute? You refuse to pay? An interesting--and dangerous--choice. So be it.
The Empire notes the build up of your fleets on our borders. What are you thinking?
Only a tyrant kicks a wounded animal. Help us heal and we can stand together.
The Empire has internal affairs to attend. Do not take offense at the closure of our borders.
The United Empire will defend its interests with all the tools at its disposal, diplomatic or otherwise. As such, I have authorized limited hostilities against your empire.
You stand in the Empire's way. Prepare to be conquered.
Ah, what a mighty weapon you wield, destroying a world on a whim. Rest assured, you will pay a heavy price for this despicable act.
Bravo, bravo! I like statements of intent, and obliterating an entire world doesn't get any clearer. We're not in your sights next, are we?
Some have called me a madman, but I would be reluctant to destroy entire worlds as you have. Our peace is under threat if you continue such insanities.
You made demands. We met those demands. Yet now you declare war. You are beneath even roaches. I spit on you, and your rotten empire.
Was my door ever not open to you? Why force this peace when asking would've achieved the same result—and kept my respect?
Well judged, ally. It is wise to make peace with those who fear you as they may act rashly and cause you great pain.
So, you impose peace? Do I look like a man who should be trifled with? No, I do not. You will do well to remember that when you consider your next move.
The peace abides! Forgive the Empire our earlier cynicism; if our positions had been reversed you would've doubted the sincerity of this imposed peace.
You imposed peace for what?! This mockery of diplomacy is of no interest to the Empire.
This peace has a price. A price that hasn't been paid yet. The Empire expects a gift--of Dust.
Good. This is good. Your gift means that we have an understanding. I can see this being a lasting peace.
So no gift. I think, when you contemplate your actions, you will regret ever having forced peace upon us. The Empire remembers.
This peace? This peace will not save you. Soon the hammer of the Empire will fall on your fleets and lands.
The Empire saves its counsel for itself. We tire of the whining of your diplomats.
Be content! Fortune smiles, for Horatio is willing to speak with you.
Now that you understand our flawless superiority, you may wish to sign a truce.
Fortunately your wisdom exceeds your oversized ego. You are wise to submit to our truce.
Luck appears to be on your side. We are forced to consider a truce.
You are wise to accept a truce, as our genetic superiority would eventually mean your end.
We cannot accept a continued status of peace when you insist on ignoring our obvious wisdom. Alas for your offspring, it is war.
Your manners (and your looks) drive us to move our nations from peace to a state of cold war.
Enough of your uncultured, knuckle-dragging ignorance! We end this alliance and give you the cold shoulder of cold war.
We offer you a place at our side, and you turn from alliance to cold war? Clearly we overestimated your intelligence.
This truce is as tepid as your personality. Horatio, on behalf of all Horatio, declares war!
You declare war upon all Horatio? I see. Were we as ugly as you, we too might consider suicide.
The chill displeases us; Horatio goes from cold war to the very hottest war.
I have spread glory and beauty across systems. Your ugly declaration of war will not stop the inevitable.
Your peace--and your conversation--is so nightmarishly dull that we have no choice but to declare war.
You wish to move from peace to war? If our music was as atonal as yours, we too might prefer the screams of our wounded.
Other than Horatio beauty, nothing really lasts. You can keep this alliance as a fond memory of our perfection until our war lays you low.
From alliance to war? Your skills at diplomacy are as hideous as your taste in garments. We gladly accept, in the name of galactic culture.
You insist on war?! Just when the spring collection was coming out. For that alone, we are glad to end this truce!
Please don't take this the wrong way, but we would prefer to share the warmth of peace with you rather than the chill of cold war.
Horatio are always content to be at peace; even the mild stress of cold war does terrible things to one's complexion.
At peace? With you? Next you'll be proposing sharing a sauna and I'm not sure our hearts are strong enough. Cold war suits me just fine.
Cold war is such an aimless, indifferent thing. Let us forge an alliance of like-minded, if not equally attractive, partners.
From cold war you propose an alliance? I'm not sure if I should be excited or terrified, but the idea intrigues me.
No, no no. From cold war to alliance? Just like that? If you misread signals that badly I wouldn't even go to a nightclub with you.
We think of you as a hopeful, if occasionally wearying, work in progress. Shall we strengthen our relations from peace to alliance in the hopes that your cultural evolution continues?
It would please Horatio to join an alliance with you. Be honored; in this pedestrian universe few things please us at all.
No. Thank you. Peace is sufficient; we prefer to stay far enough away to keep ourselves upwind.
It is the opportunity of your lifetime! Our beauty and genius allied with your, ah, more prosaic attributes.
It is a pleasure to close this negotiation on a positive note. Let us celebrate! Ah, separately…
Horatio would be the laughing stock of Horatio! I'll make it simple for you: No.
The number of more important things I have to do is beyond your math skills. Just go away.
Horatio insists. And Horatio, if gorgeous, is very stubborn.
I see. Next you'll be imposing your "culture", won't you? We hope not.
You may not see this as a compliment but it is: You have the most lovely DNA.
Why thank you. It is refreshing to see another being with a touch of good taste in this grim galaxy.
We considered insulting you, but doubted that you would understand as we occasionally use words of more than one syllable.
We could never forget this! Because we haven't laughed so hard in ages.
A hint: If you wish to be seen as being as wise as Horatio, you will agree to acquiesce.
You accuse us of putting "pressure" on you? Perhaps if you were wiser and less ugly it wouldn't be an issue.
After careful analysis, Horatio has decided that the galactic gene pool will be much healthier without you in it.
Unilaterally declaring war is your idea of a smart thing to do? We look forward to removing your DNA from the galactic gene pool.
We are an endless supply of gorgeous, fit and talented geniuses. Prepare to be darwinned.
I've had fashion consultants who were more predictable than you. If you do indeed have a mind, please make it up.
With our clever minds and refined tastes we have much to trade with you.
We look forward to becoming mutually indolent.
We would be happy to trade, if you had anything worthwhile. Sadly, we must say "No".
A glimpse into our genius must necessarily be of interest to you. Shall we share sciences?
The thought of combining our intelligence makes us weak. We agree!
As soon as you manage to develop sciences worth knowing, we would be glad to share them. But not now.
You were beginning to annoy us anyway. We are happy to close borders.
Open borders? Why not! Just mind the furniture and try to be discreet, yes?
We don't think we could survive an onslaught of your uncouth hordes. We prefer to keep our borders closed.
We have had enough mingling with lesser peoples and their unpleasant ways. We are closing our borders.
Let us open borders! We can share knowledge, art, and culture while we both get rich. A typically brilliant Horatio idea.
We have so many things that are more interesting to do. We are ignoring you.
We are known as Horatio. I am known as Horatio. Feel free to look upon us in envy.
Greetings from Horatio, the First, the Most Gorgeous.
One day every planet will be as beautiful as Horatio Prime--but first we must learn the location of these worlds! Let us share maps.
It can be painful to watch less beautiful things, but sometimes it is necessary. We agree to share what we know.
Do you not trust the finest eyes in the galaxy? Horatio's eyes? Your world is about to become a lot darker.
Horatio produces some of the finest goods in the galaxy. Maybe too good for the likes of you.
You see this cranium? This cranium--and many like it--has produced some of the finest science ever to grace the galaxy. And you want to step away from these insights. Your loss!
Horatio must admit that this war hasn't been the beautification project he'd envisaged. Horatio accepts a truce.
Horatio thinks you've been taught your lesson, and is magnanimous enough to offer a truce. What do you say?
