Why would Horatio accept a truce when Horatio's fleets are doing such sterling work laying the groundwork for galactic beautification?
Horatio's maps are things of exquisite beauty, ill fit for your tawdry empire. We will not be sharing.
You think that I, Horatio, can stand to see the galaxy from your ragtag fleets' and gaudy systems' points of view? It would be too painful. So no.
Perhaps we might trade; your more useful trinkets for some of the gorgeous products of Horatio genius.
Horatio are prepared to honor you with our friendship.
Horatio appreciate your willingness to seek our good favor.
It is not a secret that Horatio share your opinion of those repulsive fools.
Horatio laud your excellent handling of that pathetic nation of arrogant barbarians.
It is no easy task to beautify an entire galaxy, and Horatio must ask that you contribute a bit of Dust to the effort.
Do not impose such pain and displeasure on Horatio! Or be prepared to bear the consequences.
Acts of savagery upon the beauty of Horatio do not go unnoticed, and they may be avenged.
You are not up to our standards of personal hygiene; please leave Horatio territory.
Your ships fly in Horatio space; for reasons of security and beauty we want them out.
You interrupt our glorious plans for a more beautiful galaxy with your lumpish and malodorous colony.
Horatio's drive to beautify is an evolutionary imperative; do not be surprised if you soon see colonies that embody this.
Before the galaxy can be beautified it must be pacified, so we understand your recent colonization efforts.
It does not please us to see your military ships in our skies. Remove them or they will be purged in the name of beauty.
Horatio do not forget insults and ills done to us.
Horatio note an opportunity to improve and tidy a bit of the galaxy; we apologize that to do so we must remove your vessels.
Horatio graciously extend the branch of peace in spite of our obvious moral and intellectual superiority.
Sadly, our ideal of a pure and perfect galaxy cannot go far while untrustworthy deceivers like you inhabit it.
The galaxy desperately needs Horatio to beautify it, yet you purposefully block our path to doing so.
Though Horatio is always brilliant and glorious, we see that you will stoop to unworthy actions. You are no friend of Horatio.
Horatio are always content to see open borders; you must also be looking forward to the beauty of an increased Horatio presence.
Horatio are moved by your willingness to contribute to our great project of Horatiofication.
We fully intend to make the galaxy more beautiful. Perhaps you now understand why we go to war with you.
Horatio desires to close our borders; there is too much ugly out there.
Horatio are content that there have been no attacks that might interrupt our great projects.
It is good that other people also see the wisdom in doing what Horatio deem is right.
We take this offering as a homage to our perfection.
It is possible that Horatio judged you precipitously; your peaceful demeanor is encouraging.
Horatio appreciate that you conceded to our exigencies; we hope relations continue to improve.
Horatio ask that you respect our reasonable demands and you use that as grounds for war? Truly the galaxy is full of madness.
You ignore our request to leave our gorgeous empire unsullied? Your ships must leave!
Horatio are angered that you continue to plant your ugly little colonies like pimples on the galaxy. We will cleanse them.
In your arrogance and poor taste you continue to travel and build where you please. We cannot stand so much physical and moral ugliness.
Your obsession with colonization could be viewed as an act of war, or worse, littering.
For our own serenity and peace of mind we must close our borders.
Our crusade to make the universe more comely will begin with the destruction of the military fleets you persistently place in our territory--unless you stop.
Though we did not count you among our admirers, was it really necessary to destroy our gorgeous ships?
We try to be as morally perfect as we are physically ideal. We do not accept this sort of payment.
You declare war on Horatio after bearing such close witness to Horatio's perfection? Unforgivable!
I imagine Horatio science will be difficult for you to comprehend such is its majesty. But one must educate one's fellow races. A science agreement will be sent soon!
As you look on Horatio's beauty with envy, so Horatio looks upon your Dust reserves. A trade agreement could be lucrative--for both parties.
Lesser Horatios--Horatios that are shadows of I, Horatio Prime--inform me that we should trade. Therefore, we are putting together a proposal.
Given our fabulous spell of peace, Horatio considers you his best friend. Like a dog.
Horatio have had their eyes opened by some of the strange goods that your empire have traded with us. The galaxy truly is a wondrous place--in need of Horatiofication.
Genetics, cloning, replicating perfection--that's Horatio's bag. It's a marvel that your science can lend itself to other aims. Some that Horatio even find useful.
Now look here, pal. Your offending Horatio's feelings with this demand. And Horatio's feelings are some of the finest feelings in the galaxy. They shouldn't have to put up with this.
Taking notes on the galaxy's most beautiful fleets, eh? You really didn't need to send military vessels into Horatio space. Horatio are more than happy to send pics.
What do you get if you cross two Horatios? The end of the universe because no reality can withstand such perfection. Erm, and thanks--for heeding Horatio's concerns.
Horatio were spending some time alone so as not to accidentally gaze on imperfection. And you ruined it with your ugly battle fleets crawling into the Horatiocracy. Expect cold war.
Horatio have already forcefully asked you to remove your military vessels from Horatio's gorgeous territories, so now we're asking again. Only even more forcefully this time.
I suppose even I would struggle to find a gift for one who has everything. Still, etiquette dictates that demands are accompanied by some form of largesse. A bronze statue of Horatio?
The trespassing wouldn't be so bad if your battle fleets weren't so terrifically ugly. Horatio can only stomach so many incursions!
Finally, untrammeled views of Horatio's perfect territories! So long ugly fleets!
A gift! A gift! Not a GIF! And, no, Horatio don't appreciate a three-second loop of Horatio walking into a door. Horatio will petition Horatio for cold war.
A meager gesture. But everything is meager next to this specimen of perfection, isn't it? Oh well, thanks, I suppose.
Though your eyes may not be as beautiful as Horatio's, we can at least propose that they see the same things.
This agreement no longer suits us; Horatio will keep for our self what our gorgeous eyes see.
Though you cannot share the spirit and brilliance of Horatio, you can see what we have seen.
Horatio are considering offering you the honor of an alliance, so you might fight alongside such a beautiful specimen. How is your nail-care routine?
Our relations might be cold, but some seriously ugly specimens are getting together. Despite your own imperfections Horatio is considering an alliance.
Horatio's quest to beautify the galaxy could be speeded up with your help. What would you say if we offered an alliance?

Horatio is somewhat surprised at the peace that can exist between the perfect--me--and the imperfect--you--but there it is. Why don’t we consolidate this unequal affair with an alliance to counter other, uglier, unions?
Ah, Horatio sees that we share an enemy--a boil on the backside of the galaxy, indeed. Why don't we throw our lot in together and get all hot and sweaty as we lance the boil?
Horatio is somewhat agog of the resilient peace that has blossomed between our, ahem, diverse empires. Even more shocking is Horatio's intention to propose an alliance shortly.
Horatio sees you follow its magnificent figure on the path to victory. Well, who wouldn't try and emulate perfection? Anyway, Horatio thinks an alliance might save everyone trouble.
Hey, me old ally . . . erm, what's your name again? Be a good sport and lend Horatio a hand. We're having a little spot of fisticuffs bother.
Well, well, well, bitten off more than you can chew old chum? Never worry, your capable--and unreasonably handsome--ally is here to help.
A gift from Horatio to you. Exquisitely chosen, Horatio thinks you'll agree.
In no way are you to see this magnificent gift as a means of Horatio seeking benefit. More like another perfectly ethical political donation.
I'm sorry, did the gift to accompany your most rude demand get lost en-route? Horatio will be extricating themselves from this alliance post-haste.
Do you see a sign on my rather large, shiny, and regal forehead proclaiming "Sucker"? No, I don't believe you do. So behave like an ally.
This gift is rather fine--like Horatio--and makes up for previous disappointments.
Horatio is not satisfied by this paltry gift, and might need to lie down to recover.
Maybe Horatio shouldn't judge. You probably thought a being as perfect as Horatio was joking when he asked for help. Horatio wasn’t.
Horatio hasn't experienced such slowness since Horatio tried to explain the genius of its cloning tech to anyone except the Sophons. Next time, come faster!
Now, I know it's hard to imagine, but Horatio actually seeks help. Please send forthwith.

How another culture could be greater than Horatio's is . . . beyond Horatio. But, in any case, your conversion of Horatio's system without redress is most alarming. We seek to withdraw from this alliance.
Your ability to ignore Horatio's words and continue stealing Horatio's systems--peacefully or not--is most uncivil. We move to dissolve this alliance post-haste.
Of course, to compare this newly awoken "Guardian" to Horatio would not be fair, but it does have a certain charm.
Anything that can help Horatio beautify the galaxy more rapidly is always welcome. Hmm, these tendrils are fascinating . . .
So, you don't like Horatio either? Envy is such a ugly emotion, isn't it? Horatio will deal with you later.

It is such a drag to be pinned into a corner of the galaxy. Fortunately your grubby little empire offers Horatio a path to greater things. Prepare to gape open-mouthed at Horatio's beautiful battle fleets.
Distracted elsewhere? Wonderful. A prime time for Horatio to make our move. Don't pay us too much attention as you'll want to conclude your other war first.
Think of all the Horatios you deny freedom of movement with your blockade! Why should the galaxy suffer our absence for your petty reasons?
An attack on civilians is despicable. An attack on Horatio civilians is despicable and a crime against beauty.
This "Guardian" you have invoked on our world does not meet Horatio's standards of splendor. Please remove it straightaway.
The galaxy is greatly diminished this day. Your callous destruction of our world will pain all Horatio hearts forever.
For Horatio to be preserved beyond time's cruel reach would be the pinnacle of perfection. This singularity brings Horatio closer to that ideal. Well done.
No, no, no! Horatio is a fine wine that needs to be savored by the galaxy. This horrible singularity threatens our galactic beautification!
We may be at peace, but don't mistake that for an endorsement of your culture. It is--and always will be--a shadow of Horatio's. Convert another system of the great Horatiocracy at your peril.

It greatly pains Horatio to know that some of his imperfect incarnations now wander the barren landscape of your culture. What suffering they must feel! Horatio warned you not to culturally convert again, so now we move to end this peace.
Well played, well played. You obviously recognize the superiority of Horatio culture compared to your own. Now the next step is let Horatio convert your systems . . .
This singularity is an appropriate gift for a lesser empire to give a greater one. Carry on.
Well, buff my forehead with Dust, this deleterious singularity is beyond galactic norms of behavior! Cut it out!
Horatio is like the most marvelous young bird that needs to spread its wings and show its beauty to all. Your blockade is not appreciated.
(under breath) Permission for lip to wobble, Horatio. Permission denied. Don't give them the satisfaction. Ahem, Horatio didn't care about that world anyway. Slackers.
Of course you're going to lose against a side that has brains, beauty, and a domed forehead that can be seen from space. The system is Horatio's!
Huh? I blame my Z'vali underlings. Too much time in the virtual instead of the real world! Obviously the loss of this outpost can't be Horatio's fault . . .
Horatio to Empty-Head! Aren't you forgetting something? The little matter of Horatio's tribute. Do we need to ask again?
A nagging question: Those fleets amassing on Horatio's borders--they wouldn't be planning anything ugly, would they? Show some taste and keep them over there, yes?

I think there may have been a little misunderstanding here. It is Horatio's destiny to beautify the galaxy; your dastardly attacks are creating cracks in the mirror. You'll stop, won't you? Won't you? Please stop!
From time to time it is necessary for Horatio to insulate itself from the body galactic--and all its imperfect specimens. We close our borders to navel gaze. Literally.
You are a consistent pest, an annoying insect, a troublesome parasite, and we are about to eliminate you.
As the galaxy begs to be beautified, your elimination is unfortunate but necessary. Shall we call it "collateral improvement"?
If anyone is to obliterate worlds, it is I, Horatio, beautifier of the galaxy! To say we are not pleased is an understatement.
Now, your, erm, galactic re-landscaping program wouldn't be being considered for Horatio's worlds, would it? The galaxy be a much lesser place without me, no?
Horatio wants to beautify the galaxy, not erase it! In light of further planetary annihiliation we might have to reconsider this peace.
War? You declare war on I, Horatio, the most perfect specimen in the galaxy, after Horatio ceded to your ugly demands? You rotter!
For you to force peaceful relations on Horatio was the height of bad manners. But, Horatio, in his everlasting perfection, forgives you.
Even in my fear, I could feel Horatio's brand of fear was a superior one. But peace is welcome too.
So, it is peace, is it? Curious and curiouser. Oh, how you fascinate Horatio with your clumsy realpolitik!
Bravo, bravo! You have surpassed Horatio's--admittedly low--expectations with the continuance of this imposed peace. Give yourself a satisfied gaze in the mirror. Works wonders.
This hollow peace you imposed on us is a stain on your name. Don't feel too bad; it is hard, perhaps impossible, for any race to live up to Horatio's exacting standards.

You know, a man of Horatio's exquisite refinement has exceedingly expensive taste. If we are to proceed down this path of peace, then a gift of Dust is the least you can do to prove your good intentions.
Of course, a man of Horatio's perfection should be lavished with gifts in any case, but this will certainly help cement our peace.
You play a dangerous game. Horatio is not a man--nor an empire--to be trifled with. No gift begets no peace.
Horatio, in his infinite wisdom, has left the alliance so that his beautiful armies may soon be unleashed on your people. Our peace is over.
Horatio finds your entreaties, treaties, and treats all equally annoying. We are not interested in talking to you.
We are Riftborn. We come into your cosmos on a mission of survival.
We gain no satisfaction from diminishing you, and only seek our survival. Sign the truce.
A logical choice. This war benefits none.
Please, as one sentient species to another, agree to a truce.
The Riftborn are thankful. If we survive we will remember this kindness.
The Riftborn regret that relations must turn from peace to something colder. It is the way it was always destined to be, and it is the way it is.
We are not surprised you jettison the peace between our races. It is foretold.
This alliance is causing us . . . unease. The Riftborn disentangle themselves and return to more comfortable relations.
We always harbored doubts that we could make meaningful relations with the dominant species of this galaxy. So it comes to pass.
The Communion has sent orders. We are at war.
War, the bluntest of diplomatic instruments. So be it.
As it was always written. We move from distrust to all out war.
Isn't it a pitiful state of affairs? We came as strangers, seeking only refuge, and yet your response is hate and aggression. Make no mistake, we will defend our interests with extreme prejudice.
The peace between our species doesn't serve the Riftborn's purposes. Be prepared for conflict.
Are you sure you know how to fight time-shifting strangers from another dimension? We predict you will regret this choice.
This universe--its planets, its nature, but most of all its reaching, grasping lifeforms--disgusts us. This alliance is suffocating us with your stench. It is over. And we are coming to erase you.
Whatever it is you think you will find through this act of aggression, you will not.
We never knew war, back in Coroz. Yet how easily it comes to this universe.
Understand, it is not easy for us to seek a union of peace in this universe, but that is our desire.
Peace is a natural state for the Riftborn. We welcome this development.
At this time, the Riftborn wish not to entangle themselves further with other races. Let's stay . . . isolated.
For us, the future is no less hidden than the past. Everything simply is. But we must perform the dance nonetheless. What do you say to an alliance?
Intriguing. You seek an alliance with the Riftborn?
We are still trying to understand this universe--and its inhabitants. Trust isn't easy. And without trust, an alliance is impossible.
It is time for this peace to become something more. Will you join us in an alliance?
The Riftborn believe our goals are aligned. We welcome an alliance.
The Communion have instructed me to decline your offer of an alliance. A peaceful co-existence is sufficient.
We have analyzed the situation from many angles, and we believe this proposal will be mutually beneficial.
I, Grand Viceroy of New Coroz, accept your proposal on behalf of the Communion. That isn't an invitation to invade my personal space though.
I picked up a useful expression from the Sophons recently: Go swivel.
We Riftborn think it better not to speak of this so-called deal.
This is the way it will be. Nothing can change that.
We may be strangers here, but this declaration is not unexpected.
The Riftborn find most things in this universe intolerable. Not you though. We tolerate you.
I must confess, this culture of sycophancy baffles the Riftborn. Your flattery falls on deaf ears. The most important thing is for a being to know its true nature.
Most things in this universe cause us a sense of disquiet, but you truly repulse us.
Insults, like compliments, only matter to the insecure.
Your strong-arm tactics only shame your race. You should stop.
The Riftborn cannot act in any other way. I guess you would call us "determinists". The only freedom you have is how you react to the pressure in your minds.
We want to eradicate you. That's all.
We are not from this universe, we take little pleasure in enduring its reality, but we will fight to the death for our existence.
The Riftborn move to a war-footing. And our enemy is you.
Things only appear to change to limited minds. The truth is everything is still and eternal. This act of war is no surprise to the Riftborn.
You will find the Riftborn efficient and reliable trade partners. An agreement then?
Our ability to rend matter into infinite forms is not so advanced in this universe. We welcome a trade deal.
Are we missing something? Why would we agree to this meager trade agreement?
We confess to finding some science of this universe baffling, horrifying even. We wish to learn, and in return we can offer many insights.
You can help us understand why cats tossed from high buildings always land on their feet? The Riftborn are in.
We have mastered the art of traversing across dimensions, influencing the flow of time, and embodying consciousness. You've learnt E = mc2. We'll pass.
The temptation to insulate ourselves further from this universe is welcome.
The Riftborn welcome this chance to move freely in your territory. Do not pry too closer into our affairs when you visit our domain though.
No.
This is not the time for engagement. Leave our territory.
We struggle to understand and love this universe, but we are prepared to try. We wish to open our borders.
Disturb someone else.
You can call us Riftborn, for we are not of this universe.
I am the Grand Viceroy of New Coroz. There is a right time for everything, and this is the time for us, the Riftborn, to introduce ourselves.
Isn't it strange to live in such a low-dimensional universe? So banal. Nonetheless, we welcome this chance to learn where the stars hang in the great firmament.
Our eyes shall be your eyes, and your eyes ours. This is prudent.
We hail from the shadows, and we are happy to return to the shadows. It is no matter.
This. Makes. Me. Euphoric! No more of your stinking goods spoiling our colonies.
I imagine our sciences were too much for your ponderous, filthy meat-based brains to comprehend. The Riftborn do not mourn the revocation of this agreement.
War is not a natural condition for the Riftborn. We accept this truce.
War was a mistake; we have only ever wanted peaceful relations. We offer a truce.
After all the sacrifices we have made we cannot end this war in good conscience. We refuse your offer of a truce.
We have the measure of the galaxy. We do not need your star charts--and you shall not have ours.
We Riftborn prefer to keep our movements to ourselves. You will not see what we see. The answer is no.
Trade is a strange concept, but seemingly fundamental to civilizations in this cosmos. We wish to be partners.
We bear no animosity, and perhaps can even be described as fond towards your race. At least as close as we are able to be.
Your gesture suggests order and balance in your empire. Perhaps this universe is not all chaos.
We occupy congruent spaces. Maybe time will see us forge closer ties.
To see such dazzling logic, such clean moves . . . I am honored. The Communion will learn of your great deeds.
We require Dust. Our reasons are not your concern, only our need. So pay us.
We learn pain in this brutal universe. Pain caused by you. Soon you will be paid in kind.
If viciousness is the hallmark of a superior civilization, then we wish to be considered an inferior one.
Do not think you can trespass so flagrantly without repercussions. You should know your enemy better before making such choices. Remove yourselves.
Even as a master of time, your presence in Riftborn territory tests my patience. Get. Out. Now. Or suffer.
We Riftborn prefer uncolonized systems, devoid of life. Dead space. The next time you colonize a system so close to one of ours we will come for you.
Know that you won't possess that system without a struggle. We are coming.
Your choice to settle that system is . . . illogical. Or are we missing something?
Riftborn fleets are mustering as we speak. Your military trespass will not pass without ramifications.
Our race is unfamiliar with this concept of revenge. But we understand it can be a very curative act. So we will have our revenge.
It is not the nature of the cosmos we hail from, but we are not in our reality any longer, are we? We must become . . . hard. And merciless.
Your empire . . . is magnificent. Perhaps we can be at peace?
When you stand beyond time, all reveal their true nature. You are a deceiver. We will not forget this.
We will sweep through this universe, and bend it until it is to our liking. First though, you must move aside.
Tricksy creatures, aren't you? The Riftborn see you for what you are. Parasites, constantly taking, never giving. No more.
Good, the Riftborn are curious to learn more about your region--even if we might find it unpleasant at times.
We must seem like Gods. Your tribute is an act of faith, no? Sensible.
Your expansive tendencies force our hand. Every other path has been analyzed--and found wanting. It is time for conflict.
We find this universe a cruel and capricious place. Others are not welcome. We make plans to close our borders.
You shine a light for others to follow. Perhaps the races of this universe can curb their hostile impulses too?
Sensible. Our demands should be met. But make no mistake, we are neither pleased nor displeased.
The Communion back in Coroz will be pleased with the terms of this contract. We applaud your political acumen.
Peaceful interactions beget peaceful outcomes. Perhaps one day we will show you our universe, friend.
The Riftborn laud your compliance. All is in harmony again.
Desist attacking Riftborn fleets immediately. Ignore this ultimatum at your peril.
Are you certain you have the measure of the Riftborn? We are not of this universe, after all. The next ultimatum you disregard may be your last.
We Riftborn come to understand the brutal nature of this cosmos. For your repeated colonization of nearby worlds, we ready ourselves for war.
We observe your fleets trespassing in Riftborn territory. Observe and condemn.
Have I neglected to make myself clear? We Riftborn despise this universe, and all its children. Your recent colonization efforts in nearby systems are not welcome.
Riftborn space is now closed to outsiders. We wish to contemplate our place in this cosmos--in peace.
Your attack ships are marvels of engineering, sleek and beautiful, but their presence in Riftborn space has become untenable. It will be with some regret when we cause their destruction.
Violence against any Riftborn will not be tolerated. We are interdimensional refugees with a natural right to sanctuary in this universe.
Our codes must be strange to you. We are not motivated by profit, but rather the moral law within. Keep your bribe.
A strange interpretation of a peace treaty. As you wish. You will find the Riftborn a capable and enduring enemy.
Our sciences leap time and space; you would learn much from us. In return, you could educate us to the nature of matter in this universe.
Trade is not our strength, but we can make many objects that you would covet. We consider a trade agreement.
My race is understandably suspicious of others. But I try to convince them of the value of trade with you.
When we came into this universe, the idea of befriending other species was inconceivable. Thank-you for changing our preconceptions.
The exchange of consumer goods for mutual profit is more satisfying than we first imagined. And useful.
The physics and chemistry we learn from you is fascinating, but it is in the biological realm where we are truly astonished. We hope you find our sciences as enriching.
We are surprised you demand when asking may be sufficient.
We ponder on the purpose of your incursion into Riftborn-claimed space with your battle fleets. The less charitable might think you agitate for conflict. But that's not the case, is it?
We demanded that you not trespass or make demands, and you heeded us. But does that make us hypocrites?
We didn't want visitors. Especially ones with weapons. We now seek a return to more unsympathetic relations.
Be warned: remove your military fleets from Riftborn territory or we will deploy singularities and other measures to ensure our security.
A demand with nothing offered in return? Make a gesture! And, no, we don't mean another gesture like that!
We find your military posturing in our space threatening--as well as tedious and immature. If these are your feelings, let's re-establish the appropriate relations. Cold war.

We are not certain if it was mere coincidence, but the removal of your battle fleets from our territory is welcome. Now we can go gangbusters with all our weird interdimensional stuff without your prying eyes. Joke!
So, we wanted a nice gesture, and you gave us the middle digit kind--the Mavros taught us that one. Anyway, we're petitioning for a new cold war.
I guess that qualifies as a gesture of the appropriate kind . . . thanks for softening the pain of the demand. Don't make that mistake again.
The Riftborn seek to learn, but not selfishly. Shall we share vision?
Trust is ephemeral in the best of times. Now, it is gone. We rescind our vision sharing agreement.
The Riftborn would see what you have seen of this strange galaxy, and offer you our maps in return.
We are losing a war. Will you fight alongside us if we offer an alliance?
Alliances elsewhere dictate that the Riftborn consider an alliance with you.
Our peace is welcome. Perhaps it can become an alliance so that we might end the war we fight sooner? We will make a proposal soon.
Other races find common ground . . . Isn't it time we built on this peace to become an alliance and counter their threat? We will propose something soon.
Your enemy is my enemy. Would it not make sense to build on this peace and form an alliance to crush our mutual foe? Expect a proposal.
Much of this universe displeases us--but not you. We are thinking of cementing this peace with an even deeper bond--an alliance.
How strange that we are so different, yet we follow similar paths to victory. An alliance would make a logical choice.
We don't call on you without good reason, but now we seek the help of our allies. For war.
The Riftborn will always stand with their allies. We will send military help soon.
We value our relationship, ally. Hence the gift.
The Riftborn will always go the extra step for their closest allies who give us solace in a hostile universe. Enjoy our gift.
Is it not considered rude to make demands of an ally--especially without offering anything in exchange? We make plans to exit this alliance.
Are we mistaken? Are we not allies? No, we are allies. So why are you making demands of us?
We can control time, travel between universes, but this gift is still very welcome. In fact, it has made amends for your past mistakes in this alliance.
Your gift isn't enough to excuse your previous behavior. We have endured many hardships up to this moment. If this alliance collapses we won't mourn its passing.
We should've known not to trust on your help. We will always be outsiders to this universe, won't we? Long live the alliance.
Yes, the Riftborn have noted the sluggishness of your response to our call for help. Most disappointing.
So, our Endless-borne "ally" shows its true colors. We are not surprised. Please prove us wrong by sending help.
You have a strange idea of the meaning of alliance. Do allies convert their partners' systems into their empire without recompense? We will end this alliance soon.
Time reveals your true nature. Despite our pleas you continue to convert Riftborn systems to your cause. Expect this alliance to end.
Another outsider to this universe. We welcome the awakening of this guardian on our world as we share many feelings.
Forgive us, but these tendrils remind us of the blight spreading through Coroz, even though they speed our passage through this galaxy.
Attacking us while we fight on another front? We see there is little honor in this universe. Your time will come. Rest assured.
The galaxy forces our hand. We are penned in like domesticated animals, and our only path is through your empire. You would do the same.
You must understand. We are the last survivors of an entire universe; you are one of many races native to this universe. We must do whatever we can to increase our chances.
Your blockade is unwelcome. What do you hope to achieve?
May the cosmos judge you for your heinous attack on innocents. The Riftborn will not forget.
The raising of this creature on our world breaks all the conventions of war. We condemn this action in the strongest terms.
You destroy our world, but you destroy a part of yourself too, for we are not of this cosmos. Maybe one day you will feel the pain and anger we do.
The Riftborn offer their gratitude for the beneficial singularity; we were considering placing one ourselves but now we can cast our attention elsewhere.
Well, that singularity shouldn't go there. What gives?
Peaceful assimilation is preferable to violent takeover, but we'd prefer no Influence conversion of our systems whatsoever. Refrain!
Obviously, we have more to learn regarding how to make effective demands. This continued peaceful converting of our systems means we will be ending this peace as soon as possible.
We are somewhat stunned. Beings of this universe can respond to reason, and respect outsiders. Thank you for not converting any more of our systems.
It is perhaps ungracious, but in placing this beneficial singularity at such a time, we Riftborn wonder about your motives. Should we be worried?
The singularity you place on us is an affront, but at least we know your intentions. What an awful place this universe is.
Your blockade escalates tensions for no good reason. If you have a point to make, make it.
We thought we'd left behind the wanton destruction in Coroz. Maybe we are cursed.
Logistics is the Riftborn's specialty. We were always going to win the outpost race.
Somehow you won the outpost race. This is rather embarrassing for a race that prides itself on its mastery of time and logic.
The demand for tribute was not in jest. Your failure to pay will have repercussions.
Keep your fleets at a safe distance. We Riftborn have fought hard for our territory.
Would you slaughter the last remaining life of a dying universe? Please, spare us.
You act somewhat recklessly. Until you show more rationality, we are closing our borders for our own safety.
The Communion consider you a threat. My orders are to eliminate your forces where necessary.
We consider your empire a grave threat to our existence. Total war is the only rational response.
We would do anything to save the destruction of our own world, and yet you snuff out planets like they mean nothing. We will remember this.
The wanton destruction in this galaxy continues to stagger us. Please refrain from aiming your doomsday devices at our worlds.
The Communion are concerned that we are at peace with an empire who considers wholesale planetary destruction acceptable. Think carefully the next time you want to use that weapon.
What a sad little universe this is. We met your demands, yet you repay us with a declaration of war. The Riftborn will not forget.
We welcome peace, but can a unilaterally imposed peace be considered a peaceful action in of itself? We don't know.
Truthfully, you intimidated us. Hopefully this imposition of peace will lessen this feeling.
The ways of this universe are strange indeed. The peace you impose between us is worth less than the most wretched piece of weed it has been our misfortune to come across.
Our peace endures. Every day we understand the flows and eddies of this universe a little better; perhaps we were hasty to doubt your integrity towards the peace you imposed on us.
Why impose peace when you don't act accordingly? Mark our words, the Riftborn will be breaking this peace if things don't change.
The Communion ask that you offer a gift of Dust to prove your peaceful intentions are true.
We Riftborn appreciate your gift of good faith. Perhaps peaceful relations can exist between species that cross dimensions?
I was disappointed to have to relay to the Communion that no gift in recompense for the peace you forced upon us was forthcoming. We will be severing peaceful relations shortly.
We are not a species quick to anger, but you have angered us. War is coming to your worlds.
Our minds struggle with great issues and find you petty. We do not wish to speak with you.
Titanium Refining

There are some technical difficulties in refining higher-isotope ores such as assuring purity, quantity, and stability. Advanced machinery and processes ensure that the titanium produced is of impeccable quality.
Hyperium Capture

Hyper-Deuterium is a rare form of hydrogen with a heavier nucleus. This added atomic weight makes it useful as a fuel source for advanced fusion systems, and the technology that helps to obtain it is highly valuable.
Accelerated Production
Using techniques of management, logistics, parallelization, and brute force, production of almost anything can be accelerated to meet a quicker deadline -- but that comes at a cost.
Overclocked Engines

While engines built to handle the intense magnetic forces of cosmic string drive are carefully balanced and tuned, improvement in programming and engineering skills permit firmware and hardware upgrades that run the engines at higher levels of energy.
Improved Warp Compression

The compression and dilation of the space-time field around the warp bubble of the ship can be intensified with more efficient energy sources, increasing the distance traveled in a given period of time.
10-Space Engines
Utilizing insights from topology mathematics, engines can now be "folded-up" in higher dimensional space, saving both space and mass. Don't ask. Anyway, as a result, starship speeds are even higher.
Solar Exploitation Base
This industrial base, constructed and maintained in close orbit around a living star, allows the extraction of minerals and energy directly from solar bodies.
Personal Virtuality
In the form of glasses or a personal hologram environment, augmented reality systems can convince those who use them that their world is pleasant and spacious, regardless of its actual situation.
Coordinated Command

Communication technologies and reporting processes used to coordinate fleets can be adapted to use for ground battles. Whether on attack or defense, quick coordination between offensive units, reserves, and resupply elements is critical.
Hardened Probes

The boost of new materials science improves many aspects of probe technology. They are now lighter, more durable, and less expensive to manufacture; the icing on the cake is that they also have improved range.
TiVan Weapons
A new form of titanium-vanadium alloy shows great promise in defense systems. Both weapons and defenses built from this material show superior performance to previous materials.
TiVan Defenses
A new form of titanium-vanadium alloy shows great promise in defense systems. Both weapons and defenses built from this material show superior performance to previous materials.
HyperPlasma Weapons
Hyperium-based weapons are particularly effective due to the high-energy generated by fields and beams driven by hyper-deuterium.
HyperPlasma Defenses
Hyperium-based defenses are based on shields and fields that rely on the high energy generated released from hyper-deuterium fusion.
Simple Anomaly Reduction

There are a number of well-understood tasks that can be done to remove planetary anomalies. Filtering the atmosphere, removing poisons from soil, and stabilizing the magnetic field are all based on familiar, if expensive, processes.
OCP Investigation Unit

OCPs--Outside Concept Paradigms--are objects/events that are beyond explanation using existing scientific frameworks. Working with ontological reverse-engineering theory, however, this unit can help make headway understanding complex anomalies, reducing deleterious effects.
Colonize Gas-Giant

Constructed from autonomous materials that can respond swiftly to intense environmental changes, robots can now operate in the dense, stormy atmospheres of any gas-giant type planet, laying the foundation for habitation.
Floating Superstructures

Increased mastery of the atmospheres of gas giants has led to the ability to construct enormous "cities" that float on the highly turbulent chemical clouds that make up the environment. While extremely high-strength materials are required and construction is expensive, vast new habitats can be built on these hostile planets.
Primary Terraforming

While not enabling carte-blanche terraforming, the ability to construct robust structures that can adapt to changing conditions, allows planets to be altered into more benign versions of their essential type. For example, in the "hot" family, with this engineering knowledge, lava planets can become ash, which can become jungle, which can become Mediterranean.
Inverse Terraforming

A viable environment for the Riftborn is one that has an absolute minimum of life forms--which is very much the inverse of standard terraforming. This first step, using both temperature management and nutrient depletion, renders planets full of life less lush and fertile, and therefore more hospitable.
Advanced Terraforming

Sufficient experience with terraforming projects and complex geo-atmospheric sciences has led to an increase in overall terraforming performance. Given time and money, your engineers and scientists can now terraform planets into the most lush and productive planet type: Fertile.
Sterile Terraforming

In order to reach their ideal of a stable, orderly environment, the Riftborn seek to eliminate all forms of life from the planets they terraform. This advanced terrraforming technologyis designed to disrupt organic chemistry processes that create amino acids and proteins--the building blocks of life.
TiZi Alloys
Advanced alloys of titanium and zinedinium.
Hyperium Pulse Pod
Hyperium-accelerated weapons
Flexible Bureaucracy
The better you can make things move and shake, the faster you can adapt to the strangeness of intergalactic diplomacy.
Cultural Flexibility

It is one thing to have a vibrant culture and be seen as a source of intellectual stimulation, but it takes extra effort to know how to integrate and absorb other alien cultures into your glorious melting pot.
Warp Drive

The math is not easy, but it is possible to create a warp 'bubble' around a starship, and accelerate it by compressing space-time in front of the bubble while expanding space-time behind. Though there are difficulties in navigation and maneuvering, it provides a way to move independently between stars.
Condensed Tetrics
Advances in miniaturization and robotics result in improved capacity to arrange and shift ship walls and rework ship materials to maximize the efficient use of space.
Smart Cargo
With Dust-enhanced, reactive storage systems becoming a standard on ships, more weight can be brought on board a ship thanks to these adaptive real-time cargo systems.
Entropy-Shifted Modules
Some nifty tricks of topology that runs rings around the second law of thermodynamics, allows the development of a whole new suite of support modules.
Advanced Scanners
Higher energy, better data capture and analysis, and sensitivity to a wider spectrum of radiation give newer scanning technology a superior chance at discovering what the eye cannot see.
Endless Secrets

The ability to go beyond what is simply technology into something stranger -- that is what one learns with enough exposure to Endless relics and artifacts. Whatever strange energies they manipulated, scanners based on their technology (even if only vaguely understood) are far more effective.
Deep Epoch Scanning
Using psychohistory techniques, explorers can piece together diverse pieces of evidence and reconstruct the likely past of places. This enables Expeditions to discover higher level Curiosities.
The Pooster Program

In order to overcome the fear of alien worlds and worries about the dangers of space, the government launches a program designed to show other star systems as friendly, fun-loving places inhabited by improbably cheerful aliens. The program's slapstick mascot is a three-headed mushroom named "Pooster".
Patriotic Press

By deepening the links between the political and journalistic arms of Imperialist society, news organizations can disseminate the most far-fetched, ignorant, and untruthful--yet patriotic--stories to their citizens. Belief in the Empire's expansionist aims will never be greater.
G-Goods Exchange

The exchange! Since the days of caravan trading on lost worlds, commerce and markets have been the lifeblood of the galaxy. Even if it is stocks that are traded by unseen computers, the exchange still exists as a place where goods, services, and juicy rumors are found.
G-Services Exchange
This sophisticated upgrade of the Galactic Exchange, from simple resources and objects to services provided by sentient beings, is a minor change in programming with major implications.
Interstellar Conglomerate

The business of money is about to get serious. With the necessary agreements in place and ship technology up to standards, any entrepreneur with sufficient funds and ambition can make a go of success on a galactic scale.
Luxury Exploitation
Advanced capabilities to detect and exploit luxury deposits.
System Development Upgrades
These vast public projects result in major improvements to the scale and scope of life in a star system.
Mechanized Militia
Weapons, armor, communications, and transport technologies had to all take great steps into the future to create armies capable of invading planets--or defending themselves from those invaders.
Galactic-Class Military
Weapons, armor, communications, and transport technologies had to all take great steps into the future to create armies capable of invading planets--or defending themselves from those invaders.
Multi-Provision Supply
Once you know how to manage multiple lines of communication across factions and ships, it becomes trivial to set up supply lines and reinforcements that can replenish conflict zones in real time.
Catalyzed Alloys Weapons
Production of harder, denser alloys in greater quantities allows for the development of improved attack systems.
Catalyzed Alloys Defenses
Production of harder, denser alloys in greater quantities allows for the development of improved defense systems.
Peta-scale Energy Weapons
Peta-scale manufacturing techniques, which had been theorized but required too much energy, can now be employed to create powerful new hyperium weapons.
Peta-scale Field Defenses
Working at the peta-scale and driven by new high-output energy sources, new field-based defenses powered by hyperium can be added to ships.
Diffuse Exploration
Projection of mini-probes--both retrievable and expendable--allows a properly-equipped probe to gather vast amounts of probability-driven data.
Portable Magnetrons
The use of high-energy portable particle accelerators means that many strange products and systems can now be safely transported.
Xenosynergy

Knowledge of alien biology is closely tied to better understanding of alien culture and society. Armed with this, diplomats are finally able to develop political relations with the diverse sentient peoples inhabiting the galaxy.
Xenosynergy

Knowledge of alien biology is closely tied to better understanding of alien culture and society. Armed with this, Horatio diplomats are finally able to develop political relations with the diverse, but inferior, sentient peoples inhabiting the galaxy.
PRAIyer

Clever, if Machiavellian, Public Relations Artificial Intelligence analyzers run all day and every day, scanning news feeds for stories or articles critical of the government and generating automatic retorts, replies, and counter-arguments.
Government Diversity
As the populace learns about different forms of government and the many ways of expanding into the galaxy, additional political structures become possible.
Government Diversity

As the populace learns about different forms of government and the many ways of expanding into the galaxy, additional political structures become possible. Whatever is chosen, though, Zelevas will lead.
Moon Exploration
While it is easy to simply land on a moon, the construction of the necessary habitats and comm systems mean that Anomaly reduction technologies are used to do a thorough exploration.
Adamantian Refining
Refining a material as hard as adamantian may seem impossibly difficult, but the valuable military technologies it makes possible are a worthwhile goal.
Antimatter Capture
Harnessing and harvesting antimatter is expensive and error-prone; were the results not so useful few civilizations would bother.
Orichalcix Refining
The hardest material discovered so far in the galaxy is orichalcix; though refining it presents great technological difficulties the results are certainly worth the effort.
Quadrinix Capture
It may be surprising, but the most difficult part of harnessing this multi-dimensional energy source is the mathematics.

Enhanced Deka-class Hull
Enhanced Giga-class Hull

Enhanced Rational-class Hull

Enhanced Tetrahedral-class Hull
Enhanced Prime-class Hull
Ark-class Hull Level 2
Ark-class Hull Level 3
MEDIA Program

In order to improve domestic poll ratings, it is good to see positive images coming in from news feeds from other peoples and empires. By actively inserting positive PR messages into foreign news streams, Multiple Electronic DisInformation Apps boost an empire's galactic influence.
Xenostrategy

Diplomacy is an even trickier game when alien cultures and psychology are brought into the equation. Learning the preferences, attitudes, taboos, and values of alien civilizations goes a long way to learning how to outwit them.
Efficax Effect

As computer power grows and paperwork becomes virtual, much of the clunky apparatus of enacting and executing laws disappears in a flash of bytes. Note: If it is simpler to execute decisions, it is also simpler to make more of them.
Intergalactic Relations School

Trainee diplomats from across the empire, come together at the Intergalactic Relations School to learn everything they need to assist their leader's diplomatic wishes. Unlocks additional diplomacy possibilities with other advanced civilizations.
Grove of Mediation

At the Grove of Mediation, Unfallen Seconds from across the entwined empire learn the arts of more subtle diplomacy. Always keen to promote peaceful relations, the Grove nonetheless gives the greenshoots the tools to wage more aggressive options too.
The Art of Talk

The Lumeris pride themselves on their negotiating prowess, with little in life more satisfying than cutting a great deal. On the surface alien diplomacy may look easy, but that hides a great deal of thinking going on under the water--including being masters at selling the deal back to their own populace after its been signed.
Co-operation Protocol
Both you and the other empire will gain an incremental boost depending on each others' main population. The longer the Co-operative protocol lasts, the better the boost.
Co-operation Protocol
Both you and the other empire will gain an incremental boost depending on each others' main population. The longer the Co-operative protocol lasts, the better the boost.
Co-operation Protocol
Both you and the other empire will gain an incremental boost depending on each others' main population. The longer the Co-operative protocol lasts, the better the boost.
Deep Space Fuel Scoop
Provides a ready source of fuel for difficult navigation across deep space.
Hawking Radiation Dowser
Without this precious system to control the intense radiations coming out of wormholes, traversing them would not be possible.
Ultra-IR Astronomy
Very rapid, high-powered systems can be used to explore and discover previously hidden objects.
Culture Unshock
Education--and propaganda--do wonders to help populations feel less homesick, lost, and alone.
Private Spaces
The deliberate creation of both virtual and real private spaces aids greatly in reducing stress.
Adamantian Weapons
A new form of titanium-vanadium alloy shows great promise in defense systems. Both weapons and defenses built from this material show superior performance to previous materials.
Adamantian Defenses
A new form of titanium-vanadium alloy shows great promise in defense systems. Both weapons and defenses built from this material show superior performance to previous materials.
Antimatter Weapons
Antimatter-based weapons are particularly effective due to the high-energy generated by fields and beams driven by the collision of anti-particles.
Antimatter Defenses
Antimatter-based defenses are based on shields and fields that rely on the high energy generated by the explosive collisions of matter and antimatter.
Aligned Casings
Whether on projectiles, missile housings, or beam barrels, higher quality adamantian metals results in weapons able to withstand greater levels of pressure and energy and higher usage cycles.
Fracture-Free Cladding
Flaws and failure in armor and defenses generally start at the weakest point and propagate. By using atomically uniform and identical adamantian, risk of failure is greatly reduced.
Hyper-Phased Beams
By using antimatter as the energy source of beam weapons, they can be built with the dangerous ability to phase between matter and antimatter particles.
Phased Shields

Fields based on antimatter energy can be designed to pulse at frequencies that are so high they are almost impossible to measure. Fortunately, this greatly aids in de-phasing and reducing the damage potential of enemy guns.
Uplift Institute

Based in a secret location in the heart of the empire--typically built in asteroid interiors or solar atmospheres where detection is close to impossible--the Uplift Institute is a highly-classified military science facility where Empire Heroes can undergo Dust-9 enhancement.
Essence of the Virtual

The most decorated, capable members of the Church--the Heroes of the Vodyani--will enjoy specially spiked Essence when they partake in Holy communion. Laced with Dust-9, the Heroes will enjoy miraculous levels of both learning and healing.
Zero-Lag Command

Communication technologies and reporting processes used to coordinate fleets can be adapted to use for ground battles. Whether on attack or defense, quick coordination between offensive units, reserves, and resupply elements is critical.
Carapaced Swarm
With Craver Fleets partially constructed from chitinous materials harvested directly from the Hive, the Craver warmachine is stronger, faster to replenish, and cheaper to maintain. Moar carnage!
Integrated Theaters

The precision of calculation and communication needed to accurately guide thinking missiles through atmospheres can also be used to improve battlefield tactics and management. This allows more units to be activated and deployed with no loss of effectiveness.
C4 Systems

To the classic elements of C3 (Command, Control, and Communications) is added Computing as the complex calculations needed to handle weapons and trajectories in four-dimensional warfare is a non-trivial task. Without it, however, larger fleets cannot efficiently function.
Super Swarms

The ability to communicate faster and at vastly inflated bandwidths allows coordination between swarms the likes of which the galaxy has never seen before. Such huge swarms mean and number of different benefits, and are terrifying prospects for enemies.
C5 Systems

Command, Control, Communications, Computing, and... C, the speed of light. The final "c" to be integrated into advanced battle systems, the ability to react to masses moving at a measurable percentage of "c" is the final key to handling large fleet maneuvers using
Armchair Pilots

There is no longer a need to second-guess strategy and tactics. Linked in full time to battle systems, individuals can participate with quantum-coupled immediacy to ensure massively simultaneous execution of orders--ship-by-ship, fighter-by-fighter, and even missile-by-missile.
Mobile Energy Weapons
These heavy platforms can withstand the rigors of gravity and weather thanks to powerful nuclear engines and the advanced drive and weapon systems they can power.
V2A Attack
The development of hardened ships that can maneuver effectively both in vacuum and in atmosphere leads to the creation of invasion bombers.
Commercial Encryption
In order to expand and develop business networks, the advanced mathematics required for advanced security and secrecy in commercial transactions is critical.
Reliable Networks
With secrecy and security of paramount importance, local networks can be developed. These are built from both of clever technologies and very clever business partners.
Redundant Cybernetics

As a further drive to maximize the investment in beings and technology, multiple redundant miniaturized cybernetic systems are built into ships, infantry armor, and sometimes, the soldiers themselves.
Squadthink Systems

This technology works seamlessly in the background, tracking the targeting and firing decisions of squad members. Occasionally it will override them, in order to have additional weapons targeting a higher priority target.
Mobile Cryogenics

Battlefield survivability is augmented by these miniaturized systems, that can put badly wounded soldiers into states of hibernation in order to keep them alive until proper medical attention can be given.
Applied Happiness Program

A number of different 'levers' exist to control the general level of contentment of a population--wealth, security, individual freedom, self-fulfillment, pharmaceutical intake, etc. With enough knowledge, computing power, and appropriately processed alkaloids, happiness is a state of being that can be imposed from without.
Ascetic Acceptance Program

A careful system of propaganda is developed, over time, to encourage those who live on more difficult planets to see themselves as selfless pioneers, deserving of glory. Combined with generous perks and extra money invested in habitats, the populations of these harsh planets grow proud of their efforts and their reputation for toughness.
ATAC Systems

All-Time Air Conditioning uses advanced thermodynamics and efficient energy sources to make the daily life of Hot planet inhabitants more agreeable. They keep the advantages of clear weather, great beaches, and outdoor living, while still being able to get cool whenever they want.
Home and Hearth Program

"Get Cozy" is the driving force behind this public effort. Beyond the heating of public spaces and transport, habitats are equipped with stoves, excellent insulation, and quality cold weather gear. The frigid outdoors becomes an enjoyable challenge, rather than a frightening enemy.
Ark Drive
Lessons learned from the propulsion systems of the giant Arks have resulted in smaller and more efficient engines that still provide improved power. Ship speed increases; hail the Virtual Saints!
Prepped Bases

A first, pragmatic step towards using non-nationals as troops (officially or unofficially) is that two key types of bases must be built. First, anonymous and deniable outposts for the privateers to use; second, coordinated home defenses to ensure safety should the mercenaries decide to bite the hand that feeds them...
G-War Camps
War on a galactic stage requires highly energy-consumptive construction, training, and supplies. Without advanced power systems, these recruitment and development centers would be impossible.
No-G Camps

Power and production have become cheap enough that real estate is the limiting cost factor for building training and supply centers. Thanks to suit technology, any sort of space platform, whether sealed or not, can be used to house and train future soldiers.
Contained Camps

These self-contained, semi-portable barracks and training centers can now be built on essentially any type of planet or station, as improved magnetic shields and magnetized structures make them safe from radiation and easy to build.
Flash Camps

Utilizing automated construction techniques and clever scaling technology, now every inhabited area--from tiny isolated settlements to huge dense metropolises--can better contribute to the empire's military forces.
Vulnerability Assessor
Improved statistical algorithms increase the speed of messages and improve encryption levels; they also aid in doing predictive analysis of potential targets and their weaknesses.
Tactical Expertise
Coordination between ships--and even their individual weapon modules--on a fleet-wide scale adds new options to fleet and flotilla battle tactics.
Agile Command

It is not merely commanders, but also command systems, that must be agile for a wider set of battle orders to be used. More rapid computers and more tightly compacted data streams help in managing this complexity.
Battlefield Analysis

The technology required to do true battlefield analysis is mind-boggling, as it involves high-intensity scanning and analysis of vast quantities of data on particle vectors. The results, however, increase the flexibility and number of options open to fleets as they better understand friendly and enemy fleets as well as the conditions in their theater of operations.
Calculated Risks

Sometimes in battle certain risks must be taken in order to obtain a desired--if unsure--outcome. These are options for engagements that are only safe in the hands of experienced commanders, as an improper analysis of the odds could end up as serious misfortune.
Unexpected Moves

Motion and movement are key elements of any tactical decision. The battle maneuvers here take advantage of some of the possibilities of taking unexpected moves in order to take the enemy off guard or preserve a friendly advantage.

Basic System Development

There is a complex web of money, time and effort required to evolve and develop individual nations or planets. Thanks to the unusual resources harvested from alien planets, entire star systems can evolve from simple planetary bases to viable, long-term settlements.
Unlock Level 2 Upgrade Unlock Spaceport Slot x 2
Advanced System Development

Larger, more complex societies naturally require greater effort and additional resources to raise them up to a higher level of development. Greater knowledge of trade and industry is of course also indispensable for this.
Unlock Level 3 Upgrade Unlock Spaceport Slot x 1
Endless System Development

Levels of industry and technology that were once the rabid dreams of fiction writers are part of daily life. In these circumstances, and with careful if copious use of exotic alien luxuries, star systems can be raised to their highest imaginable level of civilization.
Unlock Level 4 System Development Upgrade Unlock Spaceport Slot x 2
Basic Ship Design
These are the fundamentals of galaxy-class ship designs; they are improvements on the rudimentary plans for the ships built on your home planet.
Improved Ship Design
Exploiting helpful usage and status data from practical experience, these new designs allow for improved ship robustness and efficiency.
Starting experience level for new ships is Rookie II
Advanced Ship Design
Veterans of wars and exploration and versed in the use of exotic materials and advanced technologies, your ship designers can lay plans for truly impressive craft.
Starting experience level for new ships is Rookie III
Endless Ship Design
Full of technology that would have seemed like arcane magic when your empire was first established, the ships created by these designs equate to the most advanced vessels imaginable.
Starting experience level for new ships is Veteran
Developing Empire Laws
The increasing sophistication of your government and public institutions permits your Senate to have more laws active.
Depending on your government type, additional Law Slots are available
Exemplary Empire Laws
Your empire has reached a truly impressive level of knowledge and ability. As a result, additional law slots are available for your Senate.
Depending on your government type, additional Law Slots are available
Common Curiosities
With probes that read little more than thermal and optical information, common resources can be discovered.
Reveal Curiosities related to Common Luxuries
Uncommon Curiosities
More advanced probes, with more power and wider spectrums for scanning as well as olfactory captors, can reveal uncommon resources.
Reveal curiosities related to Uncommon Luxuries
Rare Curiosities
Powerful probes, equipped with quantum computers and nano-baryonic particle scanners, can uncover even the most exotic and rare resources.
Reveal curiosities related to Rare Luxuries
Improved Commercial Drives
As your empire develops, military research trickles down to the public and makes emigration ships faster.
Holy Defense Doctrine
Asceticism and minimized personal space allow the faithful to outfit more weapons on the holy Arks.
Sanctified Arks
By minimizing non-essential activities, your engineers can outift even more modules on their ships.
Blessed Vessels
With an Ecclesiarch officially appointed to an Ark it is allowed more ordnance, and especially heavy weapons.
Consecrated Battle Arks
A rite of consecration allows the deployment of your most powerful - and holy - vessels, giving you full authority on all ship equipment--including the heaviest weapons.
Use-and-Lose Ships
While the new processes do not exactly make ships so inexpensive that they are disposable, they are certainly less costly to build.
Extra-String Drive
Silicon-Tongued Diplomats
A new institute focusing on the science of diplomacy allows Sophon negotiators to be more effective in the darker arts of interstellar relations. Or, as most call it, bribery and flattery.
-30% on Bribe or Praise Actions on Minor Factions
Cleverer Probes
Smaller, faster, smarter, and more efficient, your probe technology takes a great leap thanks to ENFER's studies.
Infernal Expertise
While a number of the lessons learned were expensive and unpleasant, one positive result of the ENFER debacle is that plans and budgets for military science research are larger and more effective.
-50% [scienceColored] cost on Military Quadrant Technology
Accelerated Research

On the plus side, the ENFER experience forced the Sophon budgeting and planning systems to be more reactive and more efficient with expenditures. Scientific advances will come faster, and the Sophons increasingly knowledgeable.
-50% [scienceColored] cost on Science and Exploration Quadrant Technology
The Science of Influence

While nobody expected the ENFER experiment to end up with vastly improved infrastructure for developing the reach and power of Sophonity, that is what has happened. Research affecting influence, agriculture and diplomacy will accelerate.
-50% [scienceColored] cost on Empire Development Quadrant Technology
Cyborg Stomachs

While adult Cravers often have lost or damaged parts repaired with cybernetics, this technology cobbled together from the Endless allows any Craver out of the egg to adapt, forage, and digest any source of mineral or vegetable available regardless of whether it is animate or inanimate.
Accelerated Ovipositor
This giant, semi-organic factory uses technology crudely adapted from the Endless to accelerate the creation and development of Craver eggs.
Endless Augmentation Factory

This plant uses advanced designs culled from Endless technology to improve the artificial limbs and other mechanical parts used to improve and repair Craver drones. As a result they can be more rapidly replaced, and driven to work harder.
+20% Health Regeneration on fleet when hero is assigned +40% Manpower Refill Rate on fleet when hero is assigned
Insatiable Maw
A massive Craver war monument, into which dead Cravers, twisted scrap metal, and other detritus of battle are thrown. Foreign diplomats always get a tour, and it's always hungry…
Refuse Force Truce without cost or penalty
Voice of the Queen
A network of disposable galactic repeaters uses battle detritus as fuel to push broadcasts about the Hive's latest victories.
Gain Influence per CP of enemy ships destroyed
Heroic Motivation
4D Spreadsheets
It takes a Dust-enhanced Hero to do it, but projects and planning can now be done in more dimensions than was previously thought possible. Productivity skyrockets on star systems with Governors.
+30% Industry on System with Governors
Apathetic Anarchy

Based on a highly detailed understanding of moods and trends, and using complex forecasting theories tied to social networks, periods of anarchy can be rendered shorter and less dangerous by making the population less interested and more conscious of the money they are costing themselves.
Anarchy period following government change reduced by 50%
Apolitical Population

In general, large changes in voting structures of government require enormous time, effort, and goodwill. With highly effective propaganda models, however, this takes far less time as the average voter can be convinced that their ballot means little, and life will go on as it has.
20% less Approval required for government change
Luxury Measures

Often the issue with Luxury Deposits is that the workers--in cahoots with the management, of course--are swiping the goods left, right, and center. Employing a special outfit who dish out, shall we say, imaginative punishments when they catch thieves, leads to much higher outputs. What do you know?
Peaceful Life
As systems develop, opportunities to make the population more comfortable increase. Sleek casinos, opulent theatres, sporting spectacles--all help people become more used to crowded worlds.
-10% on [OverPopulation] Overpopulation per System Level on Systems
Endless Fountain
This Vodyani center of worship uses recently uncovered Endless technology to multiply the Dust-based consciousnesses of those faithful souls who sacrifice themselves for the cause.
River of Holy Vigor
Churning with Dust, Essence, and the faith of thousands, this great factory-temple increases the speed with which blessed souls are merged with holy Cloth.
Cloth of Control

A new upgrade to the technology in the holy armor of the Vodyani increases the ability of the Church to monitor and control their thoughts. Though the wearer may be unhappy, they are less able to express and share these improper thoughts.
-10 [happinessColored] required to reach Rebellion Status -10 [happinessColored] required to reach Unhappy Status
Factory of Faith

The time has come to rewrite the decree on how the holy Cloth is manufactured. New and improved suits for the Vodyani souls include improvements in speed, efficiency, and comfort; though a few hardliners view these improvements as permitting weakness, in general the population is far happier.
-10 [happinessColored] required to reach Happy Status -10 [happinessColored] required to reach Ecstatic Status
Heroic Virtuality Pods
By using immersive pods from Vodyani and Virtual technologies to pre-plan assignment changes and accelerate debrief, re-training, Heroes can be immediately moved to new assignments.
No cooldown for Hero assignments
Essence Clinic
By sharing some of their precious Essence, Vodyani medical staff can rapidly heal Heroes who have been wounded.
-50% on Healing Cost on Heroes
+30 % Health Bonus on Ship
Punisher Drives

Building on rebel insights into engine power management algorithms, all fleets--existing and future--will enjoy increased weapons damage as additional energy is diverted to weapon systems at the point of firing.
Daily Slogan
Utilizing insights from pioneer psychology, by carefully determining the content and the time of day of a daily slogan, outposts can enjoy enhanced rates of growth.
+40% [foodColored] on Outpost planet
Patriotic Shipyards
With shipyards visited regularly by charismatic members of the Empire leadership who stress the importance of working flawlessly, far less materials are wasted in ship construction.
Silken Diplomacy
Sweeteners skimmed from the vast trading network in your Empire will permit smoother, less costly, diplomatic interactions.
Martial Science

Across the Empire, every citizen is mandated to spend half-a-day of free time per week contributing to Mezari scientific advancement by making themselves available to any research project. This could mean anything from donating personal computing cycles to volunteering as test subjects.
Killer Kinetics
Using the most advanced weapons technology available to the Sheredyn, new kinetic weapons systems are created to improve Sheredyn armaments.
Unlocks "Sheredyn Slugs" Battle Tactic
Cyborg Patriots

This is a volunteer-only program. Regardless of whether an individual has received military training, they can gain relatively advanced military skills using these cyborg prosthetics and brain implants. Open to all regardless of age or handicap, the technology creates perfect cannon fodder.
Unlocks "Patriotic Duty" Invasion Defense Tactic
Sheredyn College
The best and the brightest young officers of the Sheredyn fleet will be sent to this war college to study the latest technology and tactics in galactic war.
Transparent Society

In order to ensure every citizen attains every happiness they deserve, Mezari scientists will focus on learning the secrets of the mind. Every mind. Through the Transparent Society technology, no citizen will ever be alone with their shadows again and every citizen will benefit.
Museum of Manual Efforts
By creating and constantly promoting a museum glorifying industry and the fruits of labor, Horatio cleverly encourages redoubled efforts to make production and manufacturing more efficient.
Chassis Optimization

Spurred on by the influx of refugees from Coroz, Riftborn engineers have made great strides in lowering the production costs of our robotic shells by streamlining factory lines and utilizing less wasteful designs.
-50% [timelords] Construction Cost
Martial Outlook

With the rift under lockdown, the focus must be on strengthening the Riftborn's military capabilities. All factories across the empire are built or retrofitted with facilities that allow a rapid switch to the assistance of ground forces production, lowering costs.
+50% on Manpower Conversion Efficiency
Integrated Shells

Focusing Riftborn engineers efforts on improving the production costs of both embodiment and military forces simultaneously has resulted in Integrated Shells--chassis that can be easily adapted for multiple roles.
-25% [timelords] Construction Cost +25% Manpower Conversion Efficiency
Communion's Guidance
The Communion might be incarcerated, but that doesn't mean they cannot help sway the native population. Through their insights, my influence over the Riftborn will grow.
Statistical Mining
New mathematical techniques better model the distribution of strategic mineral deposits, allowing for more targeted excavations and greater yields at mining sites.
Inner Panopticon

All Riftborn chassis include embedded monitoring devices that track all movement, communication, and labor undertaken by the individual. Imperfect dedication is met with auto-punishment delivered by the same devices. Industrial output is transformed.
Tainted Dust

Every Riftborn carries a part of Coroz. When embodied with a smattering of Dust--and etched with filaments of the blight--the individual "exhales" Dust from the corrupted strands. Dust output rockets.
Fireforming
Converting cold planets to ones that can welcome Unfallen colonists can be accelerated by the aid of various applications of advanced thermodynamics, known to the Unfallen as the Fire-that-Renews.
Enables direct terraforming of: Barren into Forest Arctic into Forest Snow into Forest
Heart's Embrace

The spiritual and technological power within Koyasil, that the Unfallen refer to as the "Heart" can be used both to speed the terraforming of other planets and to prepare Unfallen colonists who will quickly adapt to the new climates.
Enables direct terraforming of: Lava into Forest Ash into Forest Desert into Forest
Denarque University

Unlike most training grounds for government leaders, Denarque does not turn out arrogant, self-serving, inbred, greedy technocrats. Instead, it graduates leaders who get things done as quickly, efficiently, and cheaply as possible. Respect for the government skyrockets.
Drone Networks

Operating independent of terrain, weather, and transportation infrastructure, squadrons of drones can deliver materials across a planet in a fraction of the time required by traditional methods--whether they are sowing seeds or supplying raw materials.
Cerebral Reality

This extension of VR entertainment technology permits many individuals to think, rather than play, together. The boost to science and productivity is worth the surprising effect of an occasional bizarre dream excerpt from a user who has dozed off.
Galactic HQ

It is from this imposing edifice that empires are ruled. Every one of an empire's star systems, from the most powerful to the most pathetic, answers to its leaders here in the seat of their power. It is the absolute heart of a civilization; to lose it would be catastrophic.
Colony Base
For your empire to grow and flourish your planets must be well-organized. This imposing administrative center ensures that finances, defense, and commercial affairs run smoothly.
Outpost Base
For your empire to grow and flourish your planets must be well-organized. This imposing administrative center ensures that finances, defense, and commercial affairs run smoothly.
The Cathedral of All Worldly Affairs

Organizing an entire star system from an orbital ark provides unique logistical challenges. This dedicated government department, occupying a dozen sectors of the Vodyani ark, ensures that all planets in the system are run as harmoniously as possible.
Microwave Pipes

These infrastructures collect the extreme energies from suns and background radiation, converting it into microwave energy piped directly to planetary infrastructures. Cheap, highly available energy raises productivity for everyone.
Distributed Energy

Sufficient understanding and control of energy generation systems leads to small, independent sources that can generate billions of watts and yet be highly mobile. Wherever energy is required--fields, plants, offices, orbitals--it can be easily and cheaply supplied.
Sustainable Farms

Advances in soil biology have opened the gate to new, low-impact farming methods that reduce the need for water, fertilizer, and sunlight. In addition, crops will be able to grow in extremes of temperature and soil quality.
Ultra Greenhouses

Hot or cold, planetary crop yields are significantly boosted with the construction of ultra greenhouses filled with all manner of Sophonic agricultural wizardry. The Sophon delicacy of hydromangoes are to die for!
Organic Purity

It isn't only Horatio who must find his ideal manifestation. Now that plant life can be better analyzed, so too must the surrounding vegetation find its perfect form. All citizens work to rid the world of unwanted weeds and lesser species, boosting Food production and simultaneously increasing the rate at which military forces replenish.
Epigenetic Crop Seeding
The ability to adapt plant DNA to its environment, and transfer those learned traits to successive generations, creates a boom in healthy, disease-resistant, long-lived crops.
Intensive Cultivation Logistics
Improving techniques in fertilizing, crop rotation, genetics, storage, and transport all lead to very efficient and high-volume food production.
Cloud Seeding Swarms

Operating out of solar platforms stationed around gas-giants and planetary satellites, these autonomous robotic swarms use precise meteorological forecasts to deliver cloud seeding minerals just where they are needed. Working at high-altitude in gas-giant atmospheres or lunar gravity wells, the swarms create huge cloud systems that can greatly promote agricultural yields.
Extreme Agrarians
With the ability to plant crops in regions that were previously deemed too climatically difficult, the Unfallen can raise yields across systems, especially on less hospitable worlds.
Cultivation Institute

Working off detailed meteorological models, these space-based modelling stations employ supercomputing server farms of unimaginable processing power to analyze thermal gradients in dry or hot planets.
